1.verse: Forefathers of Yeshua the Messiah - The book of the genealogy of Yeshua ha-Mashiach, Ben-David, Ben-Avraham:

2.verse: Abraham fathered Isaac, Isaac fathered Jacob, Jacob fathered Judah and his brothers,

3.verse: Judah fathered Perez and Zerah by Tamar, Perez fathered Hezron, Hezron fathered Ram,

4.verse: Ram fathered Amminadab, Amminadab fathered Nahshon, Nahshon fathered Salmon,

5.verse: Salmon fathered Boaz by Rahab, Boaz fathered Obed by Ruth, Obed fathered Jesse,

6.verse: and Jesse fathered David the king. David fathered Solomon by the wife of Uriah,

7.verse: Solomon fathered Rehoboam, Rehoboam fathered Abijah, Abijah fathered Asa,

8.verse: Asa fathered Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat fathered Joram, Joram fathered Uzziah,

9.verse: Uzziah fathered Jotham, Jotham fathered Ahaz, Ahaz fathered Hezekiah,

10.verse: Hezekiah fathered Manasseh, Manasseh fathered Amon, Amon fathered Josiah,

11.verse: and Josiah fathered Jeconiah and his brothers at the time of the exile to Babylon.

12.verse: After the Babylonian exile Jeconiah fathered Shealtiel, Shealtiel fathered Zerubbabel,

13.verse: Zerubbabel fathered Abiud, Abiud fathered Eliakim, Eliakim fathered Azor,

14.verse: Azor fathered Zadok, Zadok fathered Achim, Achim fathered Eliud,

15.verse: Eliud fathered Eleazar, Eleazar fathered Matthan, Matthan fathered Jacob,

16.verse: and Jacob fathered Joseph the husband of Miriam, from whom was born Yeshua who is called the Messiah.

17.verse: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations, from David until the Babylonian exile are fourteen generations, and from the Babylonian exile until the Messiah are fourteen generations.

18.verse: The Miraculous Birth of Yeshua - Now the birth of Yeshua the Messiah happened this way. When His mother Miriam was engaged to Joseph but before they came together, she was found to be pregnant through the Ruach ha-Kodesh.

19.verse: And Joseph her husband, being a righteous man and not wanting to disgrace her publicly, made up his mind to dismiss her secretly.

20.verse: But while he considered these things, behold, an angel of ADONAI appeared to him in a dream, saying, “Joseph son of David, do not be afraid to take Miriam as your wife, for the Child conceived in her is from the Ruach ha-Kodesh.

21.verse: She will give birth to a son; and you shall call His name Yeshua, for He will save His people from their sins.”

22.verse: Now all this took place to fulfill what was spoken by ADONAI through the prophet, saying,

23.verse: “Behold, the virgin shall conceive and give birth to a son, and they shall call His name Immanuel,” which means “God with us.”

24.verse: When Joseph woke up from his sleep, he did as the angel of ADONAI commanded him and took Miriam as his wife.

25.verse: But he did not know her intimately until she had given birth to a Son. And he called His name Yeshua.

1.verse: Wise Men Follow His Star - Now after Yeshua was born in Bethlehem of Judea, in the days of King Herod, magi from the east came to Jerusalem,

2.verse: saying, “Where is the One who has been born King of the Jews? For we saw His star in the east and have come to worship Him.”

3.verse: When King Herod heard, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

4.verse: And when he had called together all the ruling kohanim and Torah scholars, he began to inquire of them where the Messiah was to be born.

5.verse: So they told him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, for so it has been written by the prophet:

6.verse: ‘And you, Bethlehem, land of Judah, are by no means least among the rulers of Judah; For out of you shall come a ruler who will shepherd My people Israel.’”

7.verse: Then Herod secretly called the magi and determined from them the exact time the star had appeared.

8.verse: And he sent them to Bethlehem and said, “Go and search carefully for the Child. And when you have found Him, bring word back to me so that I may come and worship Him as well.”

9.verse: After listening to the king, they went their way. And behold, the star they had seen in the east went on before them, until it came to rest over the place where the Child was.

10.verse: When they saw the star, they rejoiced exceedingly with great gladness.

11.verse: And when they came into the house, they saw the Child with His mother Miriam; and they fell down and worshiped Him. Then, opening their treasures, they presented to Him gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh.

12.verse: And having been warned in a dream not to go back to Herod, they returned to their own country by another way.

13.verse: The Angel of ADONAI Appears - Now when they had gone, behold, an angel of ADONAI appears to Joseph in a dream, saying, “Get up! Take the Child and His mother and flee to Egypt. Stay there until I tell you, for Herod is about to search for the Child, to kill Him.”

14.verse: So he got up, took the Child and His mother during the night, and went to Egypt.

15.verse: He stayed there until Herod’s death. This was to fulfill what was spoken by ADONAI through the prophet, saying, “Out of Egypt I called My son.”

16.verse: Then when Herod saw that he had been tricked by the magi, he became furious. And he sent and killed all boys in Bethlehem and in all its surrounding area, from two years old and under, according to the time he had determined from the magi.

17.verse: Then was fulfilled what was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet, saying,

18.verse: “A voice is heard in Ramah, weeping and loud wailing, Rachel sobbing for her children and refusing to be comforted, because they are no more.”

19.verse: But when Herod died, behold, an angel of ADONAI appears in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

20.verse: saying, “Get up! Take the Child and His mother and go to the land of Israel, for those seeking the Child’s life are dead.”

21.verse: So he got up, took the Child and His mother, and went to the land of Israel.

22.verse: But hearing that Archelaus was king of Judea in place of his father Herod, he became afraid to go there. Then after being warned in a dream, he withdrew to the region of the Galilee.

23.verse: And he went and lived in a city called Natzeret, to fulfill what was spoken through the prophets, that Yeshua shall be called a Natzrati.

1.verse: John’s Witness to Israel’s Leaders - In those days, John the Immerser came proclaiming in the wilderness of Judea,

2.verse: “Turn away from your sins, for the kingdom of heaven is near!”

3.verse: For he is the one Isaiah the prophet spoke about, saying, “The voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Prepare the way of ADONAI, and make His paths straight.’”

4.verse: Now John wore clothing from camel’s hair and a leather belt around his waist, and his food was locusts and wild honey.

5.verse: Then Jerusalem was going out to him, and all Judea and all the region around the Jordan.

6.verse: Confessing their sins, they were being immersed by him in the Jordan River.

7.verse: But when he saw many Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his immersion, he said to them, “You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?

8.verse: Therefore produce fruit worthy of repentance;

9.verse: and do not think that you can say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father’! For I tell you that from these stones God can raise up children for Abraham.

10.verse: Already the axe is laid at the root of the trees; therefore every tree that does not produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire!

11.verse: “As for me, I immerse you in water for repentance. But the One coming after me is mightier than I am; I am not worthy to carry His sandals. He will immerse you in the Ruach ha-Kodesh and fire.

12.verse: His winnowing fork is in His hand, and He shall clear His threshing floor and gather His wheat into the barn; but the chaff He shall burn up with inextinguishable fire.”

13.verse: The Heavens Open at Yeshua’s Mikveh - Then Yeshua came from the Galilee to John, to be immersed by him in the Jordan.

14.verse: But John tried to prevent Him, saying, “I need to be immersed by You, and You are coming to me?”

15.verse: But Yeshua responded, “Let it happen now, for in this way it is fitting for us to fulfill all righteousness.” So John yielded to Him.

16.verse: After being immersed, Yeshua rose up out of the water; and behold, the heavens were opened to Him, and He saw the Ruach Elohim descending like a dove and coming upon Him.

17.verse: And behold, a voice from the heavens said, “This is My Son, whom I love; with Him I am well pleased!”

1.verse: Overcoming Temptation with God’s Word - Then Yeshua was led by the Ruach into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.

2.verse: After He had fasted for forty days and forty nights, He was hungry.

3.verse: And when the tempter came to Him, he said, “If You are Ben-Elohim, tell these stones to become bread.”

4.verse: But He replied, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of God.’”

5.verse: Then the devil took Him into the holy city and placed Him on the highest point of the Temple.

6.verse: “If You are Ben-Elohim,” he said, “throw Yourself down. For it is written, ‘He shall command His angels concerning you,’ and ‘upon their hands they shall lift you up, so that you may not strike your foot against a stone.’”

7.verse: Yeshua said to him, “Again it is written, ‘You shall not put ADONAI your God to the test.’”

8.verse: Again, the devil takes Him to a very high mountain and shows Him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.

9.verse: And he said to Him, “All these things I will give You, if You fall down and worship me.”

10.verse: Then Yeshua says to him, “Go away, satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship ADONAI your God, and Him only shall you serve.’”

11.verse: Then the devil leaves Him. And behold, angels came and began to take care of Him.

12.verse: Yeshua Withdraws to Seek God - Now when Yeshua heard that John had been handed over, He withdrew to the Galilee.

13.verse: Leaving Natzeret, He came and settled in Capernaum, which is by the sea in the regions of Zebulun and Naphtali.

14.verse: This was to fulfill what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,

15.verse: “Land of Zebulun and land of Naphtali, the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the nations—

16.verse: the people sitting in darkness have seen a great light, and those sitting in the region and shadow of death, on them a light has dawned.”

17.verse: From then on, Yeshua began to proclaim, “Turn away from your sins, for the kingdom of heaven is near.”

18.verse: Raising Up Fishers of Men - Now as Yeshua was walking by the Sea of Galilee, He saw two brothers, Simon who was called Peter and Andrew his brother. They were casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.

19.verse: And He said to them, “Follow Me, and I will make you fishers of men.”

20.verse: Immediately they left their nets and followed Him.

21.verse: Going on from there, He saw two other brothers, Jacob the son of Zebedee and John his brother. They were in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets, and He called them.

22.verse: Immediately they left the boat and their father and followed Him.

23.verse: Yeshua was going throughout all the Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the Good News of the kingdom, and healing every kind of disease and sickness among the people.

24.verse: News about Him spread throughout all Syria. And they brought to Him all the sick—those tormented by various diseases and afflictions, those plagued by demons, the epileptics, the paralyzed—and He healed them.

25.verse: And large crowds followed Him from the Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and beyond the Jordan.

1.verse: Drash on the Mountain - Now when Yeshua saw the crowds, He went up on the mountain. And after He sat down, His disciples came to Him.

2.verse: And He opened His mouth and began to teach them, saying,

3.verse: “Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

4.verse: “Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted.

5.verse: “Blessed are the meek, for they shall inherit the earth.

6.verse: “Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they shall be satisfied.

7.verse: “Blessed are the merciful, for they shall be shown mercy.

8.verse: “Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.

9.verse: “Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called sons of God.

10.verse: “Blessed are those who have been persecuted for the sake of righteousness, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

11.verse: “Blessed are you when people revile you and persecute you and say all kinds of evil against you falsely, on account of Me.

12.verse: Rejoice and be glad, for your reward in heaven is great! For in the same way they persecuted the prophets who were before you.”

13.verse: Called to Be Salt and Light - “You are the salt of the earth; but if the salt should lose its flavor, how shall it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything, except to be thrown out and trampled under foot by men.

14.verse: “You are the light of the world. A city set on a hill cannot be hidden.

15.verse: Neither do people light a lamp and put it under a basket. Instead, they put it on a lampstand so it gives light to all in the house.

16.verse: In the same way, let your light shine before men so they may see your good works and glorify your Father in heaven.”

17.verse: Filling the Law to the Fullest - “Do not think that I came to abolish the Torah or the Prophets! I did not come to abolish, but to fulfill.

18.verse: Amen, I tell you, until heaven and earth pass away, not the smallest letter or serif shall ever pass away from the Torah until all things come to pass.

19.verse: Therefore, whoever breaks one of the least of these commandments, and teaches others the same, shall be called least in the kingdom of heaven. But whoever keeps and teaches them, this one shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.

20.verse: For I tell you that unless your righteousness exceeds that of the Pharisees and Torah scholars, you shall never enter the kingdom of heaven!

21.verse: “You have heard it was said to those of old, ‘You shall not murder, and whoever commits murder shall be subject to judgment.’

22.verse: But I tell you that everyone who is angry with his brother shall be subject to judgment. And whoever says to his brother, ‘Raca’ shall be subject to the council; and whoever says, ‘You fool!’ shall be subject to fiery Gehenna.

23.verse: “Therefore if you are presenting your offering upon the altar, and there remember that your brother has something against you,

24.verse: leave your offering there before the altar and go. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and present your offering.

25.verse: “Make friends quickly with your opponent while you are with him on the way. Otherwise, your opponent may hand you over to the judge, and the judge to the assistant, and you will be thrown into prison.

26.verse: Amen, I tell you, you will never get out of there until you have paid back the last penny!

27.verse: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall not commit adultery.’

28.verse: But I tell you that everyone who looks upon a woman to lust after her has already committed adultery with her in his heart.

29.verse: And if your right eye causes you to stumble, gouge it out and throw it away! It is better for you that one part of your body should be destroyed, than that your whole body be thrown into Gehenna.

30.verse: And if your right hand causes you to stumble, cut it off and throw it away! It is better for you that one part of your body should be destroyed, than that your whole body go into Gehenna.

31.verse: “It was said, ‘Whoever sends his wife away, let him give her a certificate of divorce.’

32.verse: But I say to you that everyone who divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, makes her commit adultery; and whoever marries a divorced woman commits adultery.

33.verse: “Again, you have heard that it was said to those of old, ‘You shall not swear falsely, but shall carry out your oaths to ADONAI.’

34.verse: But I tell you, do not swear at all—not by heaven, for it is the throne of God;

35.verse: or by the earth, for it is the footstool of His feet; or by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the Great King.

36.verse: And do not swear by your head, for you cannot make a single hair white or black.

37.verse: But let your word ‘Yes’ be ‘Yes’ and your ‘No,’ ‘No’—anything more than this is from the evil one.”

38.verse: Overcoming Evil with Good - “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.’

39.verse: But I tell you, do not resist an evildoer. But whoever slaps you on your right cheek, turn to him also the other.

40.verse: And the one wanting to sue you and to take your shirt, let him also have your coat.

41.verse: Whoever forces you to go one mile, go with him two.

42.verse: Give to the one who asks of you, and do not turn away from the one who wants to borrow from you.

43.verse: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’

44.verse: But I tell you, love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you,

45.verse: so that you may be children of your Father in heaven. He causes His sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the righteous and the unrighteous.

46.verse: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Even the tax collectors do the same, don’t they?

47.verse: And if you greet only your brothers, what more are you doing than anyone else? Even the pagans do that, don’t they?

48.verse: Therefore be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect.”

1.verse: Righteous Living - “Beware of practicing your righteousness before others to be seen by them; otherwise you have no reward from your Father in heaven.

2.verse: So whenever you do tzedakah, do not sound a trumpet before you as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and on the streets, so that they may be glorified by men. Amen, I tell you, they have their reward in full!

3.verse: But when you do tzedakah, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,

4.verse: so that your tzedakah may be in secret; and your Father, who sees in secret, shall reward you.

5.verse: “When you pray, do not be like the hypocrites; for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and on the street corners, so that they may be seen by others. Amen, I tell you, they have their reward in full!

6.verse: But you, when you pray, go into your inner room; and when you have shut your door, pray to your Father who is in secret. And your Father, who sees in secret, shall reward you.

7.verse: And when you are praying, do not babble on and on like the pagans; for they think they will be heard because of their many words.

8.verse: Do not be like them, for your Father knows what you need before you ask Him.

9.verse: “Therefore, pray in this way: ‘Our Father in heaven, sanctified be Your name.

10.verse: Your kingdom come, Your will be done on earth as it is in heaven.

11.verse: Give us this day our daily bread.

12.verse: And forgive us our debts as we also have forgiven our debtors.

13.verse: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one.’

14.verse: “For if you forgive others their transgressions, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.

15.verse: But if you do not forgive others, neither will your Father forgive your transgressions.

16.verse: “And whenever you fast, do not become sad-faced like the hypocrites, for they neglect their faces to make their fasting evident to men. Amen, I tell you, they have their reward in full!

17.verse: But when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face,

18.verse: so that your fasting won’t be evident to men, but to your Father who is in secret. And your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.

19.verse: “Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust destroy and where thieves break in and steal.

20.verse: But store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroys and where thieves do not break in or steal.

21.verse: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

22.verse: “The eye is the lamp of the body. Therefore if your eye is good, your whole body will be full of light.

23.verse: But if your eye is bad, your body will be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!

24.verse: “No one can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will stick by one and look down on the other. You cannot serve God and money.”

25.verse: Overcoming Worry with Trust - “So I say to you, do not worry about your life—what you will eat or drink, or about your body, what you will wear. Isn’t life more than food and the body more than clothing?

26.verse: “Look at the birds of the air. They do not sow or reap or gather into barns; yet your Father in heaven feeds them. Are you not of more value than they?

27.verse: And which of you by worrying can add a single hour to his life?

28.verse: And why do you worry about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow. They neither toil nor spin.

29.verse: Yet I tell you that not even Solomon in all his glory clothed himself like one of these.

30.verse: Now if in this way God clothes the grass—which is here today and thrown into the furnace tomorrow—will He not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?

31.verse: “Therefore do not worry, saying, ‘What will we eat?’ or ‘What will we drink?’ or ‘What will we wear?’

32.verse: For the pagans eagerly pursue all these things; yet your Father in heaven knows that you need all these.

33.verse: But seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things shall be added to you.

34.verse: Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.”

1.verse: Measuring Your Measure - “Stop judging, so that you may not be judged.

2.verse: For with the judgment you judge, you will be judged; and with the measure you use, it will be measured to you.

3.verse: “Why do you look at the speck in your brother’s eye, but do not notice the beam in your own eye?

4.verse: Or how will you say to your brother, ‘Let me take the speck out of your eye,’ and look, the beam is in your own eye?

5.verse: Hypocrite, first take the beam out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to take the speck out of your brother’s eye.

6.verse: “Do not give what is holy to dogs or throw your pearls before pigs; otherwise they will trample them under their feet, then turn and rip you to shreds.

7.verse: “Ask, and it shall be given to you. Seek, and you shall find. Knock, and it shall be opened to you.

8.verse: For everyone who asks receives, and the one who seeks finds, and to the one who knocks it shall be opened.

9.verse: “For what man among you, when his son asks him for bread, will give him a stone?

10.verse: Or when he asks for a fish, will give him a snake?

11.verse: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who ask Him!

12.verse: So in all things, do to others what you would want them to do to you—for this is the Torah and the Prophets.

13.verse: “Enter through the narrow gate; for the gate is wide and the way is broad that leads to destruction, and those who enter through it are many.

14.verse: How narrow is the gate and difficult the way that leads to life, and those who find it are few.”

15.verse: Judging the Fruit - “Watch out for false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing but inwardly are ravenous wolves.

16.verse: You will recognize them by their fruit. Grapes aren’t gathered from thorn bushes or figs from thistles, are they?

17.verse: Even so, every good tree produces good fruit, but the rotten tree produces bad fruit.

18.verse: A good tree cannot produce bad fruit, nor can a rotten tree produce good fruit.

19.verse: Every tree that does not produce good fruit is chopped down and thrown into the fire.

20.verse: So then, you will recognize them by their fruit.

21.verse: “Not everyone who says to Me, ‘Lord, Lord!’ will enter the kingdom of heaven, but he who does the will of My Father in heaven.

22.verse: Many will say to Me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, didn’t we prophesy in Your name, and drive out demons in Your name, and perform many miracles in Your name?’

23.verse: Then I will declare to them, ‘I never knew you. Get away from Me, you workers of lawlessness!’”

24.verse: Building on a Firm Foundation - “Therefore everyone who hears these words of Mine and does them will be like a wise man who built his house on the rock.

25.verse: And the rain fell, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat against that house; and yet it did not fall, for its foundation had been built on the rock.

26.verse: Everyone who hears these words of Mine and does not act on them will be like a foolish man who built his house on the sand.

27.verse: And the rain fell, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat against that house; and it fell—and great was its fall.”

28.verse: Now when Yeshua had finished these words, the crowds were astounded at His teaching,

29.verse: for He was teaching them as one having authority and not as their Torah scholars.

1.verse: Healing Those who Trust - When He came down from the mountain, large crowds followed Him.

2.verse: And a man with tzara’at came to Him and bowed down before Him, saying, “Master, if You are willing, You can make me clean.”

3.verse: Yeshua stretched out His hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing. Be cleansed.” Immediately his tzara’at was cleansed.

4.verse: And Yeshua said to him, “See that you tell no one; but go show yourself to the kohen and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”

5.verse: Now when Yeshua came into Capernaum, a centurion came begging for help.

6.verse: “Master,” he said, “my servant is lying at home paralyzed, horribly tormented.”

7.verse: Yeshua said to him, “I’ll come and heal him.”

8.verse: But the centurion said, “Master, I’m not worthy to have You come under my roof. But just say the word and my servant will be healed.

9.verse: For I also am a man under authority, with soldiers under me. I say to this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”

10.verse: Now when Yeshua heard this, He marveled and said to those who were following, “Amen, I tell you, I have not found anyone in Israel with such great faith!

11.verse: Moreover, I tell you that many will come from the east and the west, and they will recline at table with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.

12.verse: But the sons of the kingdom will be driven out into the outer darkness; in that place will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”

13.verse: Then Yeshua said to the centurion, “Go. As you have believed, let it be done for you.” And the servant was healed in that same hour.

14.verse: And when Yeshua came into Peter’s house, He saw Peter’s mother-in-law lying down, sick with a fever.

15.verse: Yeshua touched her hand, and the fever left her. Then she got up and began to take care of Him.

16.verse: When evening came, the people brought to Him many who were afflicted by demons. He forced out the spirits with a word and healed all who were sick.

17.verse: So was fulfilled what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying, “He Himself took our sicknesses and carried away our diseases.”

18.verse: Following the Call - Now when Yeshua saw a crowd around Him, He gave orders to go to the other side of the sea.

19.verse: Then a Torah scholar came to Him and said, “Teacher, I will follow You wherever You go.”

20.verse: Yeshua tells him, “Foxes have dens and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head.”

21.verse: Then another of the disciples said, “Master, first let me go and bury my father.”

22.verse: But Yeshua tells him, “Follow Me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”

23.verse: Master of the Storm - As He got into the boat, His disciples followed Him.

24.verse: Suddenly a great storm arose on the sea, so that the boat was being covered by the waves. But Yeshua kept on sleeping.

25.verse: So they came and woke Him up, saying, “Master, save us! We’re perishing!”

26.verse: He said to them, “Why are you afraid, O you of little faith?” Then He got up and rebuked the winds and the sea, and it became totally calm.

27.verse: The men were amazed, saying, “What kind of person is this? Even the winds and the sea obey Him!”

28.verse: Freedom from Demons - When He came to the other side, into the region of the Gadarenes, two demon-plagued men coming from the graveyard met Him. They were so violent that no one could pass by that way.

29.verse: And they screamed, “What’s between You and us, Ben-Elohim? Have You come here to torment us, before the appointed time?”

30.verse: Now a large herd of pigs was feeding some distance away from them.

31.verse: The demons kept begging Him, “If You drive us out, send us into the herd of pigs.”

32.verse: And He told them, “Go!” So they came out and went into the pigs, and the whole herd rushed down the cliff into the sea and drowned.

33.verse: The herdsmen ran away, went into the town, and told everything, including what had happened to the demon-plagued men.

34.verse: The whole town came out to meet Yeshua. And when they saw him, they begged Him to leave their region.

1.verse: Authority to Pardon Sins - After getting into a boat, Yeshua crossed over and came to His own town.

2.verse: Just then, some people brought to Him a paralyzed man lying on a cot. And seeing their faith, Yeshua said to the paralyzed man, “Take courage, son! Your sins are forgiven.”

3.verse: Then some of the Torah scholars said among themselves, “This fellow blasphemes!”

4.verse: And knowing their thoughts, Yeshua said, “Why are you entertaining evil in your hearts?

5.verse: For which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?

6.verse: But so you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to pardon sins...” Then He tells the paralyzed man, “Get up, take your cot and go home.”

7.verse: And he got up and went home.

8.verse: When the crowd saw it, they were afraid and glorified God, who had given such authority to men.

9.verse: A Physician for Sinners - As Yeshua was passing by from there, He saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax collector’s booth. He said to him, “Follow Me.” And he got up and followed Him.

10.verse: Now it happened that when Yeshua was reclining at the table in the house, many tax collectors and sinners came and were reclining with Yeshua and His disciples.

11.verse: When the Pharisees saw this, they said to His disciples, “Why does this Teacher of yours eat with tax collectors and sinners?”

12.verse: But when He heard this, Yeshua said, “Those who are healthy have no need for a doctor, but those who are sick do.

13.verse: Now go and learn what this means: ‘Mercy I desire, and not sacrifice.’ For I didn’t come to call the righteous, but the sinful.”

14.verse: Teaching New Ways - Then John’s disciples came to Him, saying, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast, but Your disciples do not fast?”

15.verse: And Yeshua said to them, “The guests of the bridegroom cannot mourn while the bridegroom is with them, can they? But the days will come when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast.

16.verse: “And no one puts a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, for the patch pulls away from the garment and a worse tear happens.

17.verse: Nor do they put new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise the skins burst, and the wine spills out and the skins are ruined. But they put new wine into fresh wineskins, and both are preserved.”

18.verse: Compassion in the Shepherd’s Touch - Just as He was saying these things to them, a synagogue leader came and began to bow before Him, saying, “My daughter has just died, but come lay Your hand on her and she will live.”

19.verse: And Yeshua got up and began to follow him, with His disciples.

20.verse: Just then a woman, losing blood for twelve years, came from behind and touched the tzitzit of His garment.

21.verse: For she kept saying to herself, “If only I touch His garment, I will be healed.”

22.verse: But then Yeshua turned and saw her. “Take heart, daughter,” He said, “your faith has made you well.” That very hour the woman was healed.

23.verse: When Yeshua came into the synagogue leader’s house and saw the flute players and the noisy crowd wailing,

24.verse: He said, “Go away, for the girl isn’t dead, but sleeping.” And they began jeering at Him.

25.verse: But when the crowd had been cleared out, He went in and took her hand, and the girl got up.

26.verse: And news of this spread all around that region.

27.verse: As Yeshua went on from there, two blind men followed Him, crying out, “Ben-David, have mercy on us!”

28.verse: When He went into the house, the blind men came to Him. And Yeshua said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?” “Yes, Master,” they said to Him.

29.verse: Then He touched their eyes, saying, “According to your faith, let it be done for you.”

30.verse: And their eyes were opened. And Yeshua warned them sternly, “See that no one knows.”

31.verse: But they went out and spread the news about Him all around that region.

32.verse: As they were going out, a mute man plagued by a demon was brought to Him.

33.verse: After the demon was driven out, the mute man started speaking. The crowds were astounded, saying, “Never has anything like this been seen in Israel!”

34.verse: But the Pharisees were saying, “By the prince of demons He drives out demons.”

35.verse: Now Yeshua was going around all the towns and villages, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the Good News of the kingdom, and healing every kind of disease and sickness.

36.verse: When He saw the crowds, He felt compassion for them, because they were harassed and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.

37.verse: Then He said to His disciples, “The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few.

38.verse: Therefore pray to the Lord of the harvest that He may send out workers into His harvest field.”

1.verse: Instructions to the Twelve - Yeshua summoned His twelve disciples and gave them authority over unclean spirits, so they could drive them out and heal every kind of disease and sickness.

2.verse: Now these are the names of the twelve emissaries: first, Simon, called Peter, and his brother Andrew; Jacob the son of Zebedee and John his brother;

3.verse: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; Jacob, the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus;

4.verse: Simon the Zealot, and Judah the man from Kriot, the one who also betrayed Him.

5.verse: Yeshua sent out these twelve and ordered them, “Do not go to the Gentiles, and do not enter into any Samaritan town.

6.verse: But go instead to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

7.verse: As you go, proclaim, ‘The kingdom of heaven has come near!’

8.verse: Heal the sick, raise the dead, cleanse those with tzara’at, drive out demons. Freely you received, freely give.

9.verse: Do not get gold or silver or copper for your money belts,

10.verse: or a bag for the journey, or two shirts, or sandals, or a walking stick; for the worker is entitled to his food.

11.verse: “Whatever town or village you shall enter, find out who in it is worthy and stay there until you leave.

12.verse: As you come into the house, greet it.

13.verse: If the household is worthy, let your shalom come upon it. But if it’s not worthy, let your shalom return to you.

14.verse: And whoever will not receive you or listen to your words, as you leave that house or that town, shake the dust off your feet.

15.verse: Amen, I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah on the Day of Judgment than for that town.

16.verse: “Behold, I am sending you out as sheep in the midst of wolves, so be wise as serpents and innocent as doves.

17.verse: But beware of men, for they will hand you over to the courts and flog you in their synagogues.

18.verse: You will be brought before governors and kings because of Me, as a witness to them and to the Gentiles.

19.verse: But when they hand you over, do not worry about how or what you should say, for it shall be given to you in that hour what you should say.

20.verse: For it is not you speaking, but the Spirit of your Father speaking through you.

21.verse: “Brother will betray brother to death, and a father his child; and children will rise up against their parents and have them put to death.

22.verse: And you will be hated by all because of My name, but the one who endures to the end shall be saved.

23.verse: Whenever they persecute you in one city, flee to the next. Amen, I tell you, you will never finish going through the cities of Israel before the Son of Man comes.

24.verse: “A disciple is not above his teacher, nor a slave above his master.

25.verse: It is enough for the disciple to become like his teacher, and the slave like his master. If they have called the head of the house beelzebul, how much more the members of his household!

26.verse: “So do not fear them, for there is nothing concealed that will not be revealed and nothing hidden that will not be made known.

27.verse: What I tell you in the darkness, speak in the light; and what you hear in your ear, proclaim from the housetops!

28.verse: And do not fear those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul. Instead, fear the One who is able to destroy both soul and body in Gehenna.

29.verse: “Are not two sparrows sold for a penny? Yet not one of them shall fall to the ground apart from your Father’s consent.

30.verse: But even the hairs of your head are all numbered.

31.verse: So do not fear; you are worth more than many sparrows.

32.verse: “Therefore whoever acknowledges Me before men, I will also acknowledge him before My Father who is in heaven.

33.verse: But whoever denies Me before men, I will also deny him before My Father who is in heaven.

34.verse: “Do not think that I came to bring shalom on the earth; I did not come to bring shalom, but a sword.

35.verse: For I have come to set ‘a man against his father, a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law;

36.verse: and a man’s enemies will be the members of his household.’

37.verse: “He who loves father or mother more than Me isn’t worthy of Me, and he who loves son or daughter more than Me isn’t worthy of Me.

38.verse: And whoever does not take up his cross and follow after Me isn’t worthy of Me.

39.verse: He who finds his life will lose it, and he who loses his life for My sake will find it.

40.verse: “He who receives you receives Me, and he who receives Me receives the One who sent Me.

41.verse: He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet’s reward, and he who receives a tzaddik in the name of a tzaddik shall receive a tzaddik’s reward.

42.verse: And whoever gives to one of these little ones even a cup of cold water in the name of a disciple, amen I tell you, he shall never lose his reward.”

1.verse: Signs and Wonders Bear Witness - When Yeshua had finished instructing His twelve disciples, He went on from there to teach and preach in their towns.

2.verse: Now when John heard in prison about the works of the Messiah, he sent word through his disciples

3.verse: and said to Yeshua, “Are You the Coming One, or do we look for another?”

4.verse: Yeshua replied, “Go report to John what you hear and see:

5.verse: the blind see and the lame walk, those with tzara’at are cleansed and the deaf hear, and the dead are raised and the poor have good news proclaimed to them.

6.verse: Blessed is the one who is not led to stumble because of Me.”

7.verse: A Prophet Without Honor - Now as they were leaving, Yeshua began to talk to the crowd concerning John. “What did you go out to the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?

8.verse: No? So what did you go out to see? A man dressed in finery? Look, those who wear finery are in the palaces of kings!

9.verse: Then what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, even more than a prophet.

10.verse: This is the one about whom it is written, ‘Behold, I send My messenger before You, who will prepare Your way before You.’

11.verse: “Amen, I tell you, among those born of women, none has arisen greater than John the Immerser. Yet the least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.

12.verse: From the days of John the Immerser until now, the kingdom of heaven is treated with violence, and the violent grasp hold of it.

13.verse: For all the prophets and the Torah prophesied until the time of John.

14.verse: And if you are willing to accept it, he is Elijah who is to come.

15.verse: He who has ears, let him hear!

16.verse: “But to what shall I compare this generation? It’s like children sitting in the marketplaces who call to one other, saying,

17.verse: ‘We played the flute for you, but you did not dance. We wailed, but you did not mourn.’

18.verse: “For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon!’

19.verse: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Look, a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ Yet wisdom is vindicated by her deeds.”

20.verse: Then Yeshua began to denounce the towns where most of His miracles had happened, because they did not turn from their sins.

21.verse: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have turned long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

22.verse: Nevertheless I tell you, it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon on the Day of Judgment than for you.

23.verse: And you, Capernaum? Will you be lifted up to heaven? No, you will go down to Sheol! For if the miracles done in you had been done in Sodom, it would have remained to this day.

24.verse: Nevertheless I tell you that it will be more bearable for the land of Sodom on the Day of Judgment than for you.”

25.verse: Yeshua Teaches the Ways of His Father - At that time Yeshua said in response, “I praise You, Father, Lord of heaven and of earth, that You have hidden these things from the wise and discerning and revealed them to infants.

26.verse: Yes, Father, for this way was pleasing to You.

27.verse: “All things have been handed over to Me by My Father. No one knows the Son except the Father, and no one knows the Father except the Son and anyone to whom the Son chooses to reveal Him.

28.verse: Come to Me, all who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.

29.verse: Take My yoke upon you and learn from Me, for I am gentle and humble in heart, and ‘you will find rest for your souls.’

30.verse: For My yoke is easy and My burden is light.”

1.verse: The Lord of Shabbat - At that time Yeshua went through the grain fields on Shabbat. His disciples became hungry and began to pluck heads of grain and eat them.

2.verse: But when the Pharisees saw this, they said to Him, “Look, Your disciples are doing what is not permitted on Shabbat.”

3.verse: But He said to them, “Haven’t you read what David did when he became hungry, and those with him?

4.verse: How he entered into the house of God, and they ate the showbread, which was not permitted for him to eat, nor for those with him, but only for the kohanim?

5.verse: Or haven’t you read in the Torah that on Shabbat the kohanim in the Temple break Shabbat and yet are innocent?

6.verse: But I tell you that something greater than the Temple is here.

7.verse: If you had known what this means, ‘I desire mercy, not sacrifice,’ you wouldn’t have condemned the innocent.

8.verse: For the Son of Man is Lord of Shabbat.”

9.verse: Leaving from there, He went into their synagogue.

10.verse: A man with a withered hand was there. And so that they might accuse Him, they questioned Yeshua, saying, “Is it permitted to heal on Shabbat?”

11.verse: He said to them, “What man among you will not grab his sheep and lift it out, if it falls into a pit on Shabbat?

12.verse: How much more valuable then is a man than a sheep! Therefore it is permitted to do good on Shabbat.”

13.verse: Then He said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” And he stretched it out and it was restored, as healthy as the other.

14.verse: But the Pharisees went out and plotted against Him, how they might destroy Him.

15.verse: God’s Chosen Servant Brings Hope - Knowing this, Yeshua went away from there. And large crowds followed Him, and He healed them all.

16.verse: And He sternly warned them not to make Him known.

17.verse: This was to fulfill what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,

18.verse: “Here is My servant whom I chose, the One I love, in whom My soul takes delight. I will put My Ruach upon Him, and He shall proclaim justice to the nations.

19.verse: He will not quarrel or cry out, nor will anyone hear His voice in the streets.

20.verse: A crushed reed He will not break, and a smoldering wick he will not snuff out, until He brings forth justice to victory.

21.verse: And in His name the nations shall hope.”

22.verse: Whose Power Will Rule? - Then a demon-plagued man, who was blind and mute, was brought to Yeshua; and He healed him, so that he spoke and saw.

23.verse: All the crowds were astounded and saying, “This can’t be Ben-David, can it?”

24.verse: But hearing this, the Pharisees said, “This fellow drives out demons only by beelzebul, the ruler of demons.”

25.verse: Knowing their thoughts, Yeshua said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is destroyed, and every city or house divided against itself will not stand.

26.verse: If satan drives out satan, he is divided against himself; how then will his kingdom stand?

27.verse: And if I drive out demons by beelzebul, by whom do your sons drive them out? For this reason, they will be your judges.

28.verse: But if I drive out demons by the Ruach Elohim, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.

29.verse: Or how can one enter a strong man’s house and carry off his property, unless he first ties up the strong man? Then he will thoroughly plunder his house.

30.verse: He who is not with Me is against Me, and he who does not gather with Me scatters.

31.verse: “For this reason I say to you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but blasphemy against the Ruach will not be forgiven.

32.verse: Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but whoever speaks against the Ruach ha-Kodesh will not be forgiven, neither in this age nor in the one to come.”

33.verse: “Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or make the tree rotten and its fruit rotten; for the tree is known by its fruit.

34.verse: You brood of vipers! How can you who are evil say anything good? For from the overflow of the heart the mouth speaks.

35.verse: The good man from his good treasury brings forth good, and the evil man from his evil treasury brings forth evil.

36.verse: But I tell you that on the Day of Judgment, men will give account for every careless word they speak.

37.verse: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”

38.verse: A Sign Greater than Jonah - Then some of the Torah scholars and Pharisees answered Him, “Teacher, we want to see a sign from You.”

39.verse: But Yeshua replied to them, “An evil and adulterous generation clamors for a sign, yet no sign shall be given to it except the sign of Jonah the prophet.

40.verse: For just as Jonah was in the belly of the great fish for three days and three nights, so the Son of Man will be in the heart of the earth for three days and three nights.

41.verse: The men of Nineveh will rise up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented at the preaching of Jonah. And behold, something greater than Jonah is here.

42.verse: The Queen of the South will rise up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon. And behold, something greater than Solomon is here.

43.verse: “Now when an unclean spirit goes out of a man, it passes through waterless places looking for rest and doesn’t find it.

44.verse: Then it says, ‘I’ll go back home where I came from.’ And when it comes, it finds the house vacant, swept clean, and put in order.

45.verse: Then it goes and brings along seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they go in and live there. And that man’s last condition becomes worse than the first. So also will it be for this evil generation.”

46.verse: Embrace and Refrain - While Yeshua was still speaking to the crowds, His mother and brothers were standing outside, trying to speak to Him.

47.verse: Someone said to Him, “Look, Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, trying to speak to You.”

48.verse: But to the one telling Him this, Yeshua responded, “Who is My mother? And who are My brothers?”

49.verse: Stretching out His hand toward His disciples, He said, “Here are My mother and My brothers.

50.verse: For whoever does the will of My Father in heaven, he is My brother and sister and mother.”

1.verse: Simple Stories, Profound Truths - On that day after Yeshua left the house, He was sitting by the sea.

2.verse: And large crowds gathered around Him; so He got into a boat and sat down, and the whole crowd stood on the shore.

3.verse: And He told them many things in parables, saying, “Behold, a sower went out to spread some seed.

4.verse: As he was scattering the seed, some seeds fell by the road; and the birds came and ate them up.

5.verse: Other seeds fell on rocky ground, where they didn’t have much soil. They sprang up immediately, because the soil wasn’t deep.

6.verse: But when the sun came up, they were scorched; and because they had no roots, they withered away.

7.verse: Other seeds fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew and choked them out.

8.verse: But others fell on good soil and were producing fruit. They yielded a crop—some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.

9.verse: He who has ears, let him hear.”

10.verse: Then the disciples came to Him and said, “Why do You speak to them in parables?”

11.verse: And He replied to them, “To you has been given to know the secrets of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it has not been given.

12.verse: For whoever has, to him more will be given and he will have plenty. But whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.

13.verse: For this reason I speak to them in parables, because seeing they do not see, and hearing they do not hear nor do they understand.

14.verse: “And in them the prophecy of Isaiah is being fulfilled, which says, ‘You will keep on hearing but will never understand; you will keep looking, but will never see.

15.verse: For the heart of this people has become dull, their ears can barely hear, and they have shut their eyes. Otherwise they might see with their eyes, hear with their ears, and understand with their hearts. Then they would turn back, and I would heal them.’

16.verse: “But blessed are your eyes because they see, and your ears because they hear.

17.verse: Amen, I tell you, many a prophet and tzaddik longed to see what you are seeing and did not see, and to hear what you are hearing and did not hear.”

18.verse: Parable of the Sower Explained - “You then, hear the parable of the sower.

19.verse: When anyone hears the word of the kingdom and doesn’t understand it, the evil one comes and snatches away what was sown in his heart. This is the one having been sown along the road.

20.verse: “The one sown on rocky ground, this is the one who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy.

21.verse: Yet he has no root himself but lasts only a short while; and when trouble or persecution comes because of the word, immediately he falls away.

22.verse: “But the one sown among the thorns, this is the one who hears the word; and the worries of the world and the seduction of wealth choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.

23.verse: “Now the one sown on the good soil, this is the one who hears the word and understands. He indeed bears fruit, yielding a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty times what was sown.”

24.verse: Yeshua Tells More Parables - He presented to them another parable, saying, “The kingdom of heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field.

25.verse: But while the men were sleeping, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat and went away.

26.verse: Now when the stalk sprouted and produced grain, then the weeds also appeared.

27.verse: So the slaves of the landowner came and said to him, ‘Master, didn’t you sow good seed in your field? Then where did the weeds come from?’

28.verse: But he replied, ‘An enemy did this.’ Now the slaves say to him, ‘Do you want us, then, to go out and gather them up?’

29.verse: But he says, ‘No, for while you are gathering up the weeds, you may uproot the wheat with them.

30.verse: Let both grow together until the harvest. At harvest time, I will tell the reapers, “First, gather up the weeds and tie them in bundles to burn them up; but gather the wheat into my barn.’”

31.verse: He presented to them another parable, saying, “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed, which a man took and planted in his field.

32.verse: It’s the smallest of all seeds; yet when it’s full grown, it’s greater than the other herbs. It becomes like a tree, so that the birds of the air come and nest in its branches.”

33.verse: He told them another parable, “The kingdom of heaven is like hametz, which a woman took and hid in three measures of flour, until it was all leavened.”

34.verse: All these things Yeshua spoke to the crowds in parables. And apart from a parable, He wasn’t speaking to them,

35.verse: in order to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet, saying, “I will open My mouth in parables, I will utter things hidden since the foundation of the world.”

36.verse: Then He sent the crowds away and went into the house. His disciples came to Him, saying, “Explain to us the parable of the weeds of the field.”

37.verse: He answered, “The one sowing the good seed is the Son of Man,

38.verse: and the field is the world. And the good seed, these are the sons of the kingdom; and the weeds are the sons of the evil one.

39.verse: The enemy who sowed them is the devil, the harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels.

40.verse: Therefore just as the weeds are gathered up and burned with fire, so shall it be at the end of the age.

41.verse: The Son of Man will send forth His angels, and they will gather out of His kingdom all stumbling blocks and those who practice lawlessness.

42.verse: They will throw them into the fiery furnace; in that place will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

43.verse: Then the righteous will shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He who has ears, let him hear!

44.verse: “The kingdom of heaven is like a treasure hidden in the field, which a man found and hid. And because of his joy, he goes out and sells all that he has and buys that field.

45.verse: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant searching for fine pearls.

46.verse: Upon finding a pearl of great value, he went out and sold all that he had and bought it.

47.verse: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a dragnet that was cast into the sea, gathering things of every kind.

48.verse: When it was filled, they pulled it ashore; and they sat down and gathered up the good into containers, but threw the bad away.

49.verse: So it will be at the end of the age. The angels will come forth and separate the wicked from among the righteous

50.verse: and throw them into the fiery furnace; in that place will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

51.verse: “Have you understood all these things?” They said to Him, “Yes.”

52.verse: Then He said to them, “Therefore every Torah scholar discipled for the kingdom of heaven is like the master of a household who brings out of his treasure both new things and old.”

53.verse: Unbelief in the Hometown Synagogue - Now when Yeshua had finished these parables, He left that place.

54.verse: Coming into His hometown, He began to teach them in their synagogue so that they were amazed. “Where did this fellow get this wisdom and these mighty works?” they said.

55.verse: “Isn’t this the carpenter’s son? Isn’t His mother called Miriam, and His brothers Jacob and Joseph and Simon and Judah?

56.verse: And His sisters, aren’t they all with us? So where does He get all these things?”

57.verse: And they took offense at Him. But Yeshua said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his hometown and in his own house.”

58.verse: And He did not do many mighty works there because of their unbelief.

1.verse: Yeshua’s Cousin Beheaded - At that time Herod the tetrarch heard the report about Yeshua.

2.verse: He said to his servants, “This is John the Immerser—he has risen from the dead! Because of this, these powers are at work in Him.”

3.verse: For Herod had arrested John, bound him, and put him in prison for the sake of Herodias, the wife of his brother Philip,

4.verse: because John had been telling him, “It is not permitted for you to have her.”

5.verse: Although Herod wanted to kill John, he feared the crowd because they considered John a prophet.

6.verse: But when Herod’s birthday celebration came, the daughter of Herodias danced before them and pleased Herod,

7.verse: so much that he promised with an oath to give her whatever she might ask.

8.verse: Prompted by her mother, she said, “Give me the head of John the Immerser, here on a platter!”

9.verse: The king became sorrowful; but because of his oaths and those reclining with him, he commanded it to be given.

10.verse: And he sent and had John beheaded in the prison.

11.verse: His head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.

12.verse: John’s disciples came forth and took the body and buried it. Then they went and reported to Yeshua.

13.verse: Feeding Hungry Followers - Now when Yeshua heard this, He went away from there privately by boat to an isolated place. But when the crowds heard, they followed Him on foot from the towns.

14.verse: As Yeshua came ashore, He saw a large crowd and felt compassion for them and healed their sick.

15.verse: When it became evening, the disciples came to Him, saying, “This place is isolated, and the hour is already late. Send the crowds away so they can go into the villages and buy food for themselves.”

16.verse: But Yeshua said to them, “They don’t need to leave—you give them something to eat.”

17.verse: “We have nothing here except five loaves and two fish,” they said to Him.

18.verse: “Bring them here to Me,” He said.

19.verse: Ordering the crowd to recline on the grass, He took the five loaves and the two fish; and looking up to heaven, He offered the bracha. After breaking the loaves, He gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.

20.verse: They all ate and were satisfied, and the disciples picked up twelve baskets full of broken pieces left over.

21.verse: Now those eating were about five thousand men, besides women and children.

22.verse: Testing Peter’s Faith to Walk on Water - Right away, Yeshua made the disciples get into the boat and go ahead of Him to the other side, while He sent the crowds away.

23.verse: After He had sent the crowds away, He went up on the hillside by Himself to pray. And when evening came, He was there alone.

24.verse: But the boat was already a long way from land, tossed around by the waves, for the wind was against it.

25.verse: Now in the fourth watch of the night, Yeshua came to them, walking on the sea.

26.verse: But when the disciples saw Him walking on the sea, they were terrified, saying, “It’s a ghost!” And they cried out with fear.

27.verse: But immediately, Yeshua spoke to them, saying, “Take courage! I am. Don’t be afraid.”

28.verse: Answering, Peter said to Him, “Master, if it’s You, command me to come to You on the water.”

29.verse: And He said, “Come!” And Peter got out of the boat and walked on the water to go to Yeshua.

30.verse: But seeing the wind, he became terrified. And beginning to sink, he cried out, saying, “Master, save me!”

31.verse: Immediately Yeshua reached out His hand and grabbed him. And He said to him, “O you of little faith, why did you doubt?”

32.verse: When they got into the boat, the wind ceased.

33.verse: And those in the boat worshiped Him, saying, “You really are Ben-Elohim!”

34.verse: After they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret.

35.verse: And when the men of that place recognized Yeshua, they sent word into all the surrounding region. And they brought to Him all those who were in bad shape

36.verse: and kept begging Him that they might just touch the tzitzit of His garment—and all who touched it were cured.

1.verse: Religious Leaders Quiz Yeshua - Then some Pharisees and Torah scholars came to Yeshua from Jerusalem. They said,

2.verse: “Why do Your disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? For they do not do the ritual handwashing when they eat bread.”

3.verse: And answering, He said to them, “Why do you also transgress the commandment of God for the sake of your tradition?

4.verse: For God said, ‘Honor your father and mother’ and ‘He who speaks evil of father or mother must be put to death.’

5.verse: But you say, ‘Whoever tells his father or mother, “Whatever you might have gained from me is a gift to God,”

6.verse: he need not honor his father.’ On account of your tradition, you made void the word of God.

7.verse: Hypocrites! Rightly did Isaiah prophesy about you, saying,

8.verse: ‘This people honors Me with their lips, but their heart is far from Me.

9.verse: And in vain they worship Me, teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’”

10.verse: Then Yeshua called the crowd and said to them, “Hear and understand.

11.verse: It’s not what goes into the mouth that makes the man unholy; but what comes out of the mouth, this makes the man unholy.”

12.verse: Then the disciples came and said to Him, “Do You know that the Pharisees took offense when they heard this saying?”

13.verse: But He replied, “Every plant that My heavenly Father has not planted will be uprooted.

14.verse: Leave them alone; they are blind guides of the blind. And if a blind man leads a blind man, both will fall into a pit.”

15.verse: Then Peter answered and said to Him, “Explain this parable to us.”

16.verse: “Are you also still lacking understanding?” Yeshua said.

17.verse: “Don’t you grasp that whatever goes into the mouth passes into the stomach and then is ejected into the sewer?

18.verse: But the things that proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart, and those things make the man unholy.

19.verse: For out of the heart come evil thoughts, murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false witness, and slander.

20.verse: These are the things that make the man unholy; but to eat with unwashed hands does not make the man unholy.”

21.verse: A Reward for a Humble Woman - Now Yeshua left from there and went away to the region of Tyre and Sidon.

22.verse: And behold, a Canaanite woman from that district came out and started shouting, “Have mercy on me, O Master, Ben-David! My daughter is severely tormented by a demon.”

23.verse: But He did not answer her a word. And when His disciples came, they were urging Him, saying, “Send her away, because she keeps shouting at us.”

24.verse: But He responded, “I was sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”

25.verse: So she came and got down on her knees before Him, saying, “Master, help me!”

26.verse: And answering, He said, “It’s not right to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”

27.verse: But she said, “Yes, Master, but even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters’ table.”

28.verse: Then answering, Yeshua said to her, “O woman, great is your faith! Let it be done for you as you wish.” And her daughter was healed in that very hour.

29.verse: After Yeshua left there, He went along the Sea of Galilee. Then He went up on a mountainside and was sitting there.

30.verse: And large crowds came to Him, bringing with them the lame, blind, disabled, mute, and many others. And they laid them at His feet, and He healed them.

31.verse: So the crowd marveled when they saw the mute speaking, the disabled made whole, the lame walking, and the blind seeing. And they praised the God of Israel.

32.verse: Feeding More Hungry Followers - Yeshua called His disciples and said, “I have compassion for the crowd, because they’ve stayed with Me for three days now and have nothing to eat. I don’t want to send them away hungry, because they might pass out on the way.”

33.verse: The disciples said to Him, “Where in this wasteland is enough bread to satisfy such a large crowd?”

34.verse: Yeshua said to them, “How many loaves do you have?” “Seven,” they said, “and a few small fish.”

35.verse: After directing the crowd to recline on the ground,

36.verse: He took the seven loaves and the fish; and after giving thanks, He broke them. And He began giving them to the disciples, and the disciples to the crowds.

37.verse: And they all ate and were satisfied. And they picked up the broken pieces left over—seven baskets full.

38.verse: And those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.

39.verse: And after sending away the crowds, Yeshua got into the boat and went to the region of Magadan.

1.verse: Religious Leaders Demand Signs - Now the Pharisees and Sadducees came up, and testing Yeshua, they asked Him to show them a sign from heaven.

2.verse: But He replied to them, “When evening comes, you say, ‘Fair weather coming, for the sky is red,’

3.verse: and in the morning, ‘Stormy weather today, for the sky is red and gloomy.’ You know how to discern the appearance of the sky, but you cannot discern the signs of the times!

4.verse: An evil and adulterous generation clamors for a sign, yet no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.” And leaving them behind, He went away.

5.verse: Now when the disciples came to the other side of the sea, they had forgotten to take bread.

6.verse: “Watch out,” Yeshua said to them, “and beware of the hametz of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”

7.verse: And they began to discuss among themselves, saying, “We didn’t bring any bread.”

8.verse: But knowing this, Yeshua said, “O you of little faith, why do you discuss among yourselves that you have no bread?

9.verse: You still don’t get it? Don’t you remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many baskets of leftovers you gathered?

10.verse: Or how about the seven loaves for the four thousand and all the baskets of leftovers you gathered?

11.verse: How is it that you don’t understand that I wasn’t talking to you about bread? Now beware of the hametz of the Pharisees and Sadducees!”

12.verse: Then they understood that He wasn’t talking about the hametz in the bread, but about the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

13.verse: The Father Reveals His Son - When Yeshua came into the region of Caesarea Philippi, He asked His disciples, “Who do people say that the Son of Man is?”

14.verse: They answered, “Some say John the Immerser, others say Elijah, and still others say Jeremiah or one of the other prophets.”

15.verse: He said, “But who do you say I am?”

16.verse: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Messiah, the Son of the living God.”

17.verse: Yeshua said to him, “Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah, because flesh and blood did not reveal this to you, but My Father who is in heaven!

18.verse: And I also tell you that you are Peter, and upon this rock I will build My community; and the gates of Sheol will not overpower it.

19.verse: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven. Whatever you forbid on earth will have been forbidden in heaven and what you permit on earth will have been permitted in heaven.”

20.verse: Then He ordered the disciples not to tell anyone that He was the Messiah.

21.verse: First Prediction: Death and Resurrection - From that time on, Yeshua began to show His disciples that He must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders and ruling kohanim and Torah scholars, and be killed, and be raised on the third day.

22.verse: Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him, saying, “Never, Master! This must never happen to You!”

23.verse: But He turned and said to Peter, “Get behind Me, satan! You are a stumbling block to Me, for you are not setting your mind on the things of God, but the things of men.”

24.verse: Then Yeshua said to His disciples, “If anyone wants to follow after Me, he must deny himself, take up his cross, and follow Me.

25.verse: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake will find it.

26.verse: For what will it profit a man if he gains the whole world but forfeits his soul? Or what will a man give in exchange for his soul?

27.verse: For the Son of Man is about to come in the glory of His Father with His angels, and then ‘He will repay everyone according to his deeds.’

28.verse: Amen, I tell you, there are some standing here who will not taste death until they see the Son of Man coming in His kingdom.”

1.verse: Two Witnesses and a Voice from Heaven - After six days, Yeshua takes with Him Peter and Jacob and John his brother, and brings them up a high mountain by themselves.

2.verse: Now He was transfigured before them; His face shone like the sun, and His clothes became as white as the light.

3.verse: And behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them, talking with Yeshua.

4.verse: Peter responded to Yeshua, “Master, it’s good for us to be here! If You wish, I will make three sukkot here—one for You, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”

5.verse: While He was still speaking, suddenly a bright cloud overshadowed them; and behold, a voice from out of the cloud, saying, “This is My Son, whom I love; with Him I am well pleased. Listen to Him!”

6.verse: When the disciples heard this, they fell face down, terrified.

7.verse: But Yeshua came and touched them. “Get up,” He said. “Stop being afraid.”

8.verse: And lifting their eyes, they saw no one except Yeshua alone.

9.verse: As they were coming down from the mountain, Yeshua commanded them, saying, “Do not tell anyone about the vision until the Son of Man is raised from the dead.”

10.verse: The disciples questioned Him, saying, “Why then do the Torah scholars say that Elijah must come first?”

11.verse: Yeshua replied, “Indeed, Elijah is coming and will restore all things.

12.verse: I tell you that Elijah already came; and they didn’t recognize him, but did to him whatever they wanted. In the same way, the Son of Man is about to suffer at their hands.”

13.verse: Then the disciples understood that He was speaking to them about John the Immerser.

14.verse: See What Faith Can Do - When they came to the crowd, a man came to Yeshua, falling on his knees before Him and saying,

15.verse: “Master, have mercy on my son, for he has seizures and suffers badly. For he often falls into the fire and often into the water.

16.verse: I brought him to Your disciples, but they couldn’t heal him.”

17.verse: And answering, Yeshua said, “O faithless and twisted generation! How long shall I be with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring him here to Me.”

18.verse: Yeshua rebuked the demon and it came out of him, and the boy was healed from that very hour.

19.verse: Then the disciples came to Yeshua in private and said, “Why couldn’t we drive it out?”

20.verse: And He said to them, “Because you trust so little. Amen, I tell you, if you have faith the size of a mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you.”

22.verse: Second Prediction: Death and Resurrection - Now while they were gathering in the Galilee, Yeshua said to them, “The Son of Man is about to be delivered into the hands of men;

23.verse: and they will kill Him, and on the third day He will be raised.” And the disciples became greatly distressed.

24.verse: When they came to Capernaum, the collectors of the Temple tax came to Peter and said, “Your teacher pays the Temple tax, doesn’t He?”

25.verse: “Yes,” Peter said. Now when Peter came into the house, Yeshua spoke to him first, saying, “What do you think, Simon? The kings of the earth, from whom do they collect tolls or tax? From their sons or from strangers?”

26.verse: After Peter said, “From strangers,” Yeshua said to him, “Then the sons are free.

27.verse: But so that we do not offend them, go to the sea and throw out a hook, and take the first fish that comes up. And when you open its mouth, you’ll find a coin. Take that, and give it to them, for Me and you.”

1.verse: Childlike Humility - At that hour the disciples came to Yeshua, saying, “Who then is greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”

2.verse: And He called a child to Himself, set him in the midst of them,

3.verse: and said, “Amen, I tell you, unless you turn and become like children, you shall never enter the kingdom of heaven.

4.verse: Whoever then shall humble himself like this child, this one is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

5.verse: And whoever welcomes one such child in My name, welcomes Me.

6.verse: “But whoever causes one of these little ones who trust in Me to stumble, it would be better for him to have a heavy millstone hung around his neck and to be sunk in the depth of the sea!

7.verse: Woe to the world because of snares! For snares must come, but woe to that man through whom the snare comes!

8.verse: “And if your hand or your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off and throw it away from you. It’s better for you to enter into life crippled or lame than, having two hands or two feet, to be thrown into fiery Gehenna.

9.verse: If your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out and throw it away from you. It’s better for you to enter into life with one eye than, having two eyes, to be thrown into fiery Gehenna.

10.verse: Parable of the Lost Sheep - “See that you do not despise one of these little ones, for I tell you that their angels in heaven continually see the face of My Father in heaven.

12.verse: “What do you think? If a certain man has a hundred sheep and one of them goes astray, won’t he leave the ninety-nine on the mountains and go looking for the one that is straying?

13.verse: And if he finds it, amen I tell you, he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine that didn’t stray.

14.verse: Even so, it’s not the will of your Father in heaven that one of these little ones should be lost.”

15.verse: Restoring a Lost Brother - “Now if your brother sins against you, go and show him his fault while you’re with him alone. If he listens to you, you have won your brother.

16.verse: But if he does not listen, take with you one or two more, so that ‘by the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may stand.’

17.verse: But if he refuses to listen to them, tell it to Messiah’s community. And if he refuses to listen even to Messiah’s community, let him be to you as a pagan and a tax collector.

18.verse: “Amen, I tell you, whatever you forbid on earth will have been forbidden in heaven and what you permit on earth will have been permitted in heaven.

19.verse: Again I say to you, that if two of you agree on earth about anything they may ask, it shall be done for them by My Father in heaven.

20.verse: For where two or three are gathered together in My name, there I am in their midst.”

21.verse: Lessons about Forgiveness - Then Peter came to Him and said, “Master, how often shall I forgive my brother when he sins against me? Up to seven times?”

22.verse: Yeshua said to him, “No, not up to seven times, I tell you, but seventy times seven!

23.verse: Therefore, the kingdom of heaven may be compared to a king who wanted to settle accounts with his slaves.

24.verse: When he had begun to settle up, a man was brought to him who owed him ten thousand talents.

25.verse: But since he didn’t have the money to repay, his master ordered him to be sold, along with his wife and children and all that he had, and payment to be made.

26.verse: Then the slave fell on his knees and begged him, saying, ‘Be patient with me, and I’ll repay you everything.’

27.verse: And the master of that slave, filled with compassion, released him and forgave him the debt.

28.verse: “Now that slave went out and found one of his fellow slaves who owed him a hundred denarii. And he grabbed him and started choking him, saying, ‘Pay back what you owe!’

29.verse: “So his fellow slave fell down and kept begging him, saying, ‘Be patient with me, and I’ll pay you back.’

30.verse: Yet he was unwilling. Instead, he went off and threw the man into prison until he paid back all he owed.

31.verse: “So when his fellow slaves saw what had happened, they were deeply distressed. They went to their master and reported in detail all that had happened.

32.verse: Then summoning the first slave, his master said to him, ‘You wicked slave! I forgave all that debt because you pleaded with me.

33.verse: Wasn’t it necessary for you also to show mercy to your fellow slave, just as I showed mercy to you?’

34.verse: Enraged, the master handed him over to the torturers until he paid back all he owed.

35.verse: “So also My heavenly Father will do to you, unless each of you, from your hearts, forgives his brother.”

1.verse: Marriage and Covenant Faithfulness - Now when Yeshua had finished these words, He moved on from the Galilee and entered the region of Judea beyond the Jordan.

2.verse: Large crowds followed Him, and He healed them there.

3.verse: Pharisees came up to Yeshua, testing Him and saying, “Is it permitted for a man to divorce his wife for any reason at all?”

4.verse: “Haven’t you read?” He answered. “He who created them from the beginning ‘made them male and female’

5.verse: and said, ‘For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife, and the two shall become one flesh.’

6.verse: So they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, let no man separate.”

7.verse: They said to Him, “Why then did Moses command to ‘give her a certificate of divorce and put her away?’”

8.verse: Yeshua said to them, “Because of your hardness of heart Moses permitted you to divorce your wives, but from the beginning it was not so.

9.verse: Now I tell you, whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another, commits adultery.”

10.verse: The disciples said to Him, “If that’s the case for a man and his wife, it’s better not to marry!”

11.verse: But He said to them, “Not everyone can accept this saying—only those to whom it has been given.

12.verse: For there are eunuchs who were born that way from their mother’s womb; and there are eunuchs who were made that way by men; and there are eunuchs who made themselves eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of heaven. He who can accept this, let him accept it.”

13.verse: Receiving the Kingdom of Heaven - Then little children were brought to Yeshua so that He might lay hands upon them and pray. Then the disciples rebuked those who brought them.
