14.verse: But Yeshua said, “Let the little children come to Me and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these.”

15.verse: After laying His hands upon them, He went on from there.

16.verse: Now behold, one came to Him and said, “Teacher, what good shall I do to have eternal life?”

17.verse: “Why do you ask Me about what is good?” Yeshua said to him. “There is only One who is good; but if you want to enter into life, keep the commandments.”

18.verse: “Which ones?” he said. Yeshua said, “‘Do not murder, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not give false testimony,

19.verse: honor your father and mother,’ and ‘love your neighbor as yourself.’”

20.verse: “All these I’ve kept,” the young man said to Him. “What do I still lack?”

21.verse: Yeshua said to him, “If you wish to be perfect, go, sell what you own, and give to the poor; and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow Me.”

22.verse: But when the young man heard this statement, he went away grieving, for he had much property.

23.verse: Then Yeshua said to His disciples, “Amen, I tell you, it is hard for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven.

24.verse: Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”

25.verse: When the disciples heard this, they were utterly astonished and said, “Then who can be saved?”

26.verse: And looking, Yeshua said to them, “With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”

27.verse: Then Peter said to Him, “Look, we’ve left everything to follow You! So what will we have?”

28.verse: And Yeshua said to them, “Amen, I tell you, when the Son of Man sits on His glorious throne in the new world, you who have followed Me shall also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

29.verse: And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or property, for My name’s sake, will receive a hundred times as much, and will inherit eternal life.

30.verse: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”

1.verse: Parable of the Day Laborers - “For the kingdom of heaven is like the master of a household, who went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.

2.verse: Now when he had agreed with the workers for a denarius per day, he sent them into his vineyard.

3.verse: And he went out about the third hour and saw others standing in the marketplace, idle.

4.verse: And to them he said, ‘You go into the vineyard too, and I’ll give you whatever is right.’

5.verse: So they went. Again he went out about the sixth and ninth hour and did the same.

6.verse: And about the eleventh hour, he went out and found others standing around. And he said to them, ‘Why have you been standing here idle the whole day?’

7.verse: “‘Because no one hired us,’ they said to him. “He said to them, ‘You go into the vineyard, too.’

8.verse: “Now when evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his foreman, ‘Call the workers and pay them their wages, beginning from the last to the first.’

9.verse: And those who had come about the eleventh hour each received a denarius.

10.verse: And when the first came, they supposed that they would receive more; yet they too received a denarius.

11.verse: “But when they received it, they began to grumble against the master of the house,

12.verse: saying, ‘These last guys did one hour, and you’ve made them equal to us, who bore the burden and scorching heat of the day!’

13.verse: “But answering, he said to one of them, ‘Friend, I’m doing you no wrong. Didn’t you agree with me on a denarius?

14.verse: Take what is yours and go. But I want to give this last guy the same as you.

15.verse: Am I not permitted to do what I want with what belongs to me? Or is your eye evil because I am good?’

16.verse: “So the last will be first, and the first last.”

17.verse: Third Prediction: Death and Resurrection - Now as Yeshua was going up to Jerusalem, He took the Twelve aside privately; and on the way he told them,

18.verse: “Look, we’re going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the ruling kohanim and Torah scholars. They will condemn Him to death

19.verse: and hand Him over to the Gentiles to mock, and to scourge, and to crucify. Yet on the third day, He will be raised up.”

20.verse: Leading by Serving - Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came with her sons to Yeshua, and she was kneeling down and asking something from Him.

21.verse: “What do you want?” He said to her. She said to Him, “Declare that these two sons of mine might sit, one on Your right and one on Your left, in Your kingdom.”

22.verse: But Yeshua replied, “You don’t know what you’re asking! Are you able to drink the cup I am about to drink?” “We are able,” they say to Him.

23.verse: He said to them, “You shall indeed drink My cup. But to sit on My right and left, this isn’t Mine to grant. Rather, it’s for those for whom it has been prepared by My Father.”

24.verse: Now when the ten heard, they became indignant with the two brothers.

25.verse: But Yeshua called them over and said, “You know that the rulers of the nations lord it over them, and their great ones play the tyrant over them.

26.verse: It shall not be this way among you. But whoever wants to be great among you shall be your servant,

27.verse: and whoever wants to be first among you shall be your slave—

28.verse: just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life as a ransom for many.”

29.verse: What Do You Want Me to Do for You? - Now as they were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed Him.

30.verse: And here two blind men sitting by the roadside, when they heard that Yeshua was passing by, cried out, saying, “Have mercy on us, O Master, Ben-David!”

31.verse: The crowd warned them to be quiet, but they cried out all the more, saying, “Have mercy on us, O Master, Ben-David!”

32.verse: Yeshua stopped and called out to them. “What do you want Me to do for you?” He said.

33.verse: They said to Him, “Master, let our eyes be opened!”

34.verse: Moved with compassion, Yeshua touched their eyes. Instantly they regained their sight and followed Him.

1.verse: Baruch Ha-Ba! Blessed Is He Who Comes! - Now as they drew near to Jerusalem and came to Bethphage, to the Mount of Olives, then Yeshua sent two disciples,

2.verse: saying to them, “Go into the village before you. Right away, you’ll find a donkey tied up and a colt with her. Untie them and bring them to Me.

3.verse: If anyone says anything to you, you shall say, ‘The Master needs them.’ And right away he will send them.”

4.verse: This happened to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet, saying,

5.verse: “Say to the daughter of Zion, ‘See, your King is coming to you, humble and sitting on a donkey, a colt, the foal of a donkey.’”

6.verse: The disciples went and did as Yeshua had directed them.

7.verse: They brought the donkey and colt and put their clothing on them, and He sat on the clothing.

8.verse: Most of the crowd spread their clothing on the road, and others began cutting branches from the trees and spreading them on the road.

9.verse: The crowds going before Him and those following kept shouting, saying, “Hoshia-na to Ben-David! Baruch ha-ba b’shem ADONAI! Blessed is He who comes in the name of the LORD! Hoshia-na in the highest!”

10.verse: When He entered Jerusalem, the whole city was stirred up, saying, “Who is this?”

11.verse: And the crowds kept saying, “This is the prophet Yeshua, from Natzeret in the Galilee.”

12.verse: Then Yeshua entered the Temple and drove out all those selling and buying in the Temple. He overturned the tables of the moneychangers and the seats of those selling doves.

13.verse: And He said to them, “It is written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer,’ but you are making it ‘a den of thieves’!”

14.verse: The blind and lame came to Him in the Temple, and He healed them.

15.verse: But when the ruling kohanim and Torah scholars saw the wonders He performed, and the children crying out in the Temple and saying, “Hoshia-na to Ben-David,” they became indignant.

16.verse: And they said to Him, “Do You hear what these children are saying?” “Yes,” Yeshua said to them. “Haven’t you ever read, ‘Out of the mouth of babes and nursing toddlers You have prepared praise for Yourself’?”

17.verse: Then He left them and went out of the city to Bethany, and He spent the night there.

18.verse: Faith Moves Mountains - Now early in the morning, as He was returning to the city, He became hungry.

19.verse: Seeing a lone fig tree by the road, He came up to it and found nothing on it except leaves only. And He said to it, “May no fruit ever come from you again!” And the fig tree shriveled up at once.

20.verse: When the disciples saw it they were astonished. “How did the fig tree shrivel on the spot?” they asked.

21.verse: Yeshua answered them, “Amen, I tell you, if you have faith and do not doubt, not only will you do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you say to this mountain, ‘Be taken up and thrown into the sea,’ it will happen.

22.verse: And whatever you ask in prayer, trusting, you shall receive.”

23.verse: Questions about Yeshua’s Authority - Now when He entered the Temple, the ruling kohanim and the elders of the people came to Him while He was teaching, saying, “By what authority are You doing these things? Who gave You this authority?”

24.verse: Yeshua replied to them, “I also will ask you one question. If you tell Me, I likewise will tell you by what authority I do these things.

25.verse: John’s immersion, where was it from? From heaven or from men?” They began to dialogue among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say to us, ‘Then why didn’t you believe him?’

26.verse: But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the crowd, for all hold up John as a prophet.”

27.verse: So answering Yeshua, they said, “We don’t know.” Then He said to them, “Neither am I telling you by what authority I do these things.”

28.verse: A Parable about Intentions and Actions - “Now what do you think? A man had two sons, and he went to the first and said, ‘Son, go work in the vineyard today.’

29.verse: The son answered, ‘I won’t,’ but afterward he had a change of heart and went.

30.verse: The man went to the second son and said the same thing. But he answered, ‘I will, sir,’ and didn’t go.

31.verse: Which of the two did the will of the father?” “The first,” they said. Yeshua said to them, “Amen, I tell you, the tax collectors and prostitutes are going ahead of you into the kingdom of God.

32.verse: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him. But the tax collectors and prostitutes did believe him; and even after you saw this, you had no change of heart to believe him.”

33.verse: Parable of the Vineyard - “Listen to another parable. There was a master of a household who planted a vineyard. He put a hedge around it, dug a winepress in it, and built a tower. Then He leased it to some tenant farmers and went on a journey.

34.verse: Now when fruit season drew near, he sent his servants to the tenants to collect his fruit.

35.verse: But grabbing his servants, the tenants beat up one, killed another, and stoned still another.

36.verse: Again the master sent other servants, even more than the first, and they did the same thing to them.

37.verse: Finally he sent his son to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

38.verse: “But when the tenants saw the son, they said among themselves, ‘This is the heir! Come on, let’s kill him and get his inheritance!’

39.verse: So grabbing him, they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.

40.verse: Therefore when the master of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those tenants?”

41.verse: “He will bring those miserable men to a miserable end,” they said to Him, “and will lease the vineyard to other tenants, who will give him his share of the fruits in their seasons.”

42.verse: Yeshua said to them, “Have you never read in the Scriptures? ‘The stone which the builders rejected, this has become the chief cornerstone. This came from ADONAI, and it is marvelous in our eyes.’

43.verse: Therefore I say to you, the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to people producing its fruits.

44.verse: Whoever falls on this stone will be shattered; but the one upon whom it falls, it will crush him.”

45.verse: When the ruling kohanim and Pharisees heard Yeshua’s parables, they realized He was talking about them.

46.verse: Although they were trying to seize Him, they feared the crowds, because they regarded Him as a prophet.

1.verse: Invitation to the Wedding Feast - Yeshua answered and spoke to them again in parables, saying,

2.verse: “The kingdom of heaven may be compared to a king who made a wedding feast for his son.

3.verse: He sent out his servants to call those who were invited to the wedding feast, but they wouldn’t come.

4.verse: Again he sent out other servants, saying, ‘Tell those who were invited, “Look, I’ve prepared my meal. My oxen and fattened cattle are killed, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding feast!”’

5.verse: “But paying no attention, they went away, one to his own farm, another to his business.

6.verse: And the rest grabbed his servants, humiliated them, and killed them.

7.verse: Now the king became furious! Sending his troops, he destroyed those murderers and set fire to their city.

8.verse: “Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding feast is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy.

9.verse: So go into the highways and byways, and invite everyone you find to the wedding feast.’

10.verse: And those servants went out into the highways and gathered together all they found, both bad and good; and the wedding was filled with guests.

11.verse: “But when the king came in to look over the guests, he saw a man there who wasn’t dressed in wedding clothes.

12.verse: ‘Friend,’ he said to him, ‘how did you get in here without wedding clothes?’ But the man was silent.

13.verse: Then the king said to his servants, ‘Tie him up hand and foot, and throw him into the outer darkness; in that place will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’

14.verse: For many are called, but few are chosen.”

15.verse: A Trap about Paying Taxes - Then the Pharisees went and plotted how they might trap Him with a word.

16.verse: And they sent to Him some of their disciples, along with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that You are honest and teach the way of God in truth. And what others think doesn’t concern You, for You do not look at men’s appearance.

17.verse: Tell us therefore, what do You think? Is it permitted to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”

18.verse: But Yeshua, knowing their wickedness, said, “Why are you testing Me, you hypocrites?

19.verse: Show Me the tax money.” So they brought Him a denarius.

20.verse: And He said to them, “Whose image is this? And whose inscription?”

21.verse: “Caesar’s,” they said to Him. Then He said to them, “Give therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”

22.verse: And hearing this, they were amazed. So they left Him and went away.

23.verse: Religious Leaders Ask a Tricky Question - On that day, Sadducees (who say there is no resurrection) came to Yeshua and questioned Him, saying,

24.verse: “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If someone dies having no children, his brother as next of kin shall marry his widow and father children for his brother.’

25.verse: Now there were seven brothers among us. The first married and died; and having no offspring, left his wife to his brother.

26.verse: In the same way also the second, and the third, down to the seventh.

27.verse: Last of all, the woman died.

28.verse: So in the resurrection, whose wife of the seven will she be? For they all had married her.”

29.verse: But answering, Yeshua said to them, “You’ve gone astray, because you don’t understand the Scriptures or the power of God.

30.verse: For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.

31.verse: But concerning the resurrection of the dead, haven’t you read what was spoken to you by God, saying,

32.verse: ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? He is not the God of the dead, but of the living!”

33.verse: When the crowds heard this, they were astounded at His teaching.

34.verse: The Greatest Mitzvot - But the Pharisees, when they heard that Yeshua had silenced the Sadducees, gathered together in one place.

35.verse: And testing Him, one of them, a lawyer, asked,

36.verse: “Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the Torah?”

37.verse: And He said to him, “‘You shall love ADONAI your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind.’

38.verse: This is the first and greatest commandment.

39.verse: And the second is like it, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’

40.verse: The entire Torah and the Prophets hang on these two commandments.”

41.verse: Yeshua Overturns the Arguments - Now while the Pharisees were gathered together, Yeshua asked them a question,

42.verse: saying, “What do you think about the Messiah? Whose Son is He?” “David’s,” they say to Him.

43.verse: “Then how is it,” He says to them, “that David by the Ruach calls him ‘Lord’?

44.verse: For he says, ‘ADONAI said to my Lord, “Sit at My right hand, until I put Your enemies under Your feet.”’

45.verse: If David then calls Him ‘Lord,’ how is He his son?”

46.verse: No one was able to answer Him a word. Nor did anyone dare from that day on to question Him any longer.

1.verse: Seven Woes - Then Yeshua spoke to the crowds and to His disciples,

2.verse: saying, “The Torah scholars and Pharisees sit on the seat of Moses.

3.verse: So whatever they tell you, do and observe. But don’t do what they do; for what they say, they do not do.

4.verse: They tie up heavy loads, hard to carry, and lay them on men’s shoulders; but they themselves aren’t willing to lift a finger to move them.

5.verse: All their works they do to be noticed by men. They make their tefillin wide and their tzitziyot long.

6.verse: They love the place of honor at feasts, the best seats in the synagogues,

7.verse: greetings in the marketplaces, and to be called rabbi by men.

8.verse: “But you are not to be called rabbi; for One is your Teacher, and you are all brothers.

9.verse: And call no man on earth your father; for One is your Father, who is in heaven.

10.verse: Nor are you to be called teachers; for One is your Teacher, the Messiah.

11.verse: But the greatest among you shall be your servant.

12.verse: Whoever exalts himself shall be humbled, and whoever humbles himself shall be exalted.

13.verse: “But woe to you, Torah scholars and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you shut people out of the kingdom of heaven. For you do not enter yourselves, nor do you let those enter who are trying to go in.

15.verse: “Woe to you, Torah scholars and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you travel over land and sea to make one convert. And when he becomes one, you make him twice as much a son of Gehenna as yourself.

16.verse: “Woe to you, blind guides! You say, ‘Whoever swears by the Temple, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gold of the Temple, he is obligated.’

17.verse: O fools and blind ones! Which is greater, the gold or the Temple that made the gold holy?

18.verse: And you say, ‘Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the offering on it, he is obligated.’

19.verse: O blind ones! Which is greater, the offering or the altar that makes the offering holy?

20.verse: Therefore, whoever swears by the altar, swears both by the altar and everything on it.

21.verse: And whoever swears by the Temple, swears both by the Temple and by Him who dwells in it.

22.verse: And whoever swears by heaven, swears both by the throne of God and by Him who sits on it.

23.verse: “Woe to you, Torah scholars and Pharisees, hypocrites! You tithe mint and dill and cumin, yet you have neglected the weightier matters of Torah—justice and mercy and faithfulness. It is necessary to do these things without neglecting the others.

24.verse: O blind guides, straining out a gnat while swallowing a camel!

25.verse: “Woe to you, Torah scholars and Pharisees, hypocrites! You clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside they are full of greed and uncontrolled desire.

26.verse: O blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and dish, so that the outside may become clean as well.

27.verse: “Woe to you, Torah scholars and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitewashed tombs, which look beautiful on the outside but inside are full of dead men’s bones and everything unclean.

28.verse: In the same way, you appear righteous to men on the outside, but are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.

29.verse: “Woe to you, Torah scholars and Pharisees, hypocrites! You build tombs for the prophets and decorate the monuments of the tzaddikim.

30.verse: And you say, ‘If we’d been alive in the days of our forefathers, we wouldn’t have been partners with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’

31.verse: So you testify against yourselves, that you are sons of those who murdered the prophets.

32.verse: Fill up, then, the measure of your fathers!

33.verse: O snakes, you brood of vipers! How will you escape the condemnation of Gehenna?

34.verse: “Because of this, behold, I’m sending you prophets and wise men and Torah scholars. Some of them you will kill and execute at the stake, and some of them you will scourge in your synagogues and persecute from city to city.

35.verse: And so, upon you shall come all the righteous blood shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Berechiah, whom you murdered between the Temple and the altar.

36.verse: Amen, I tell you, all these things will come upon this generation.”

37.verse: Holy Temple to Be Destroyed - “O Jerusalem, Jerusalem who kills the prophets and stones those sent to her! How often I longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were not willing!

38.verse: Look, your house is left to you desolate!

39.verse: For I tell you, you will never see Me again until you say, ‘Baruch ha-ba b’shem ADONAI. Blessed is He who comes in the name of the LORD!’”

1.verse: Now when Yeshua went out and was going away from the Temple, His disciples came up to point out to Him the Temple buildings.

2.verse: “Don’t you see all these?” He responded to them. “Amen, I tell you, not one stone will be left here on top of another—every one will be torn down!”

3.verse: Signs of the End of Time - As He was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to Him privately, saying, “Tell us, when will these things happen? What will be the sign of Your coming and of the end of the age?”

4.verse: Yeshua answered them, “Be careful that no one leads you astray!

5.verse: For many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am the Messiah,’ and will lead many astray.

6.verse: You will hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you are not alarmed, for this must happen but it is not yet the end.

7.verse: For nation will rise up against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. And there will be famines and earthquakes in various places.

8.verse: But all these things are only the beginning of birth pains.

9.verse: “Then they will hand you over to persecution and will kill you. You will be hated by all the nations because of My name.

10.verse: And then many will fall away and will betray one another and hate one other.

11.verse: Many false prophets will arise and lead many astray.

12.verse: Because lawlessness will multiply, the love of many will grow cold.

13.verse: But the one who endures to the end will be saved.

14.verse: This Good News of the kingdom shall be proclaimed in the whole world as a testimony to all the nations, and then the end will come.

15.verse: “So when you see ‘the abomination of desolation,’ which was spoken of through Daniel the prophet, standing in the Holy Place (let the reader understand),

16.verse: then those in Judea must flee to the mountains.

17.verse: The one on the roof must not go down to take what is in his house,

18.verse: and the one in the field must not turn back to get his coat.

19.verse: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing babies in those days!

20.verse: Pray that your escape will not happen in winter, or on Shabbat.

21.verse: For then there will be great trouble, such as has not happened since the beginning of the world until now, nor ever will.

22.verse: And unless those days were cut short, no one would be delivered. But for the sake of the chosen, those days will be cut short.

23.verse: “Then if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here’s the Messiah,’ or ‘There He is,’ do not believe it.

24.verse: For false messiahs and false prophets will rise up and show great signs and wonders so as to lead astray, if possible, even the chosen.

25.verse: See, I have told you beforehand.

26.verse: “So if they say to you, ‘Look, He is in the wilderness,’ do not go out. Or, ‘Look, He is in the inner rooms,’ do not believe it.

27.verse: For just as lightning comes from the east and flashes as far as the west, so also will be the coming of the Son of Man.

28.verse: For wherever the carcass is, there the vultures will gather.

29.verse: “But immediately after the trouble of those days, ‘the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light and the stars will fall from heaven and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.’

30.verse: Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven, and then all the tribes of the land will mourn, and they will see ‘the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven’ with power and great glory.

31.verse: He will send out His angels with a great shofar, and they will gather together His chosen from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.”

32.verse: Watching for Messiah’s Return - “Now learn the parable from the fig tree. When its branch becomes tender and puts forth leaves, you know that summer is near.

33.verse: So also, when you see all these things, know that it is near, at the door.

34.verse: Amen, I tell you, this generation will not pass away until all these things happen.

35.verse: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will never pass away.

36.verse: But of that day and hour no one knows, not even the angels of heaven nor the Son, except the Father alone.

37.verse: “For just as the days of Noah were, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

38.verse: For in those days before the flood, they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day Noah entered the ark.

39.verse: And they did not understand until the flood came and swept them all away. So shall it be at the coming of the Son of Man.

40.verse: Then two men will be in the field, one taken and one left.

41.verse: Two women will be grinding at the mill, one taken and one left.

42.verse: Therefore stay alert; for you do not know what day your Lord is coming.

43.verse: But know this, that if the master of the house had known what time the thief was coming, he would have kept watch and not let his house be broken into.

44.verse: So you also must be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at an hour you do not expect.”

45.verse: The Faithful Servant - “Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom the master put in charge of his household to give them food at the proper time?

46.verse: Blessed is that servant whose master finds him so doing when he comes.

47.verse: Amen, I tell you, his master will put him in charge of all his possessions.

48.verse: But if that wicked servant says in his heart, ‘My master is taking a long time,’

49.verse: and he begins to beat his fellow servants, and he eats and drinks with drunkards,

50.verse: the master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he does not know.

51.verse: And he will cut him in two and assign his place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”

1.verse: Parable of the Ten Virgins - “Then the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.

2.verse: Five of them were foolish, and five were wise.

3.verse: For when the foolish ones took their lamps, they took no oil with them.

4.verse: But the wise ones took oil in jars along with their lamps.

5.verse: “Now while the bridegroom was taking a long time, they all got drowsy and started falling asleep.

6.verse: But in the middle of the night there was a shout, ‘Look, the bridegroom! Come out to meet him!’

7.verse: Then all those virgins got up and trimmed their lamps.

8.verse: Now the foolish ones said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil, since our lamps are going out.’

9.verse: But the wise ones replied, ‘No, there won’t be enough for us and for you. Instead, go to those who sell, and buy some for yourselves.’

10.verse: “But while they were going off to buy, the bridegroom came. And those who were ready went in with him to the wedding feast, and the door was shut.

11.verse: Now later, the other virgins came, saying, ‘Sir, Sir, open up for us!’

12.verse: “But he replied, ‘Amen, I tell you, I do not know you.’

13.verse: Therefore stay alert, for you know neither the day nor the hour.”

14.verse: Parable of the Talents - “For it is like a man about to go on a journey. He called his own servants and handed over his possessions to them.

15.verse: To one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one, each according to his own ability. Then he went on his journey.

16.verse: “Immediately the one who had received the five talents went and traded with them and gained five more.

17.verse: In the same way, the one with two gained two more.

18.verse: But the one who received one went off and dug a hole in the ground and hid his master’s money.

19.verse: “Now after a long time, the master of those servants came and settled accounts with them.

20.verse: The one who had received the five talents came up and brought another five talents, saying, ‘Master, you handed me five talents. Look, I’ve gained five more.’

21.verse: His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant! You were faithful with a little, so I’ll put you in charge of much. Enter into your master’s joy!’

22.verse: “The one who had received the two talents also came up and said, ‘Master, you handed me two talents. Look, I’ve gained two more.’

23.verse: His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant! You were faithful with a little, so I’ll put you in charge of much. Enter into your master’s joy!’

24.verse: “Then the one who had received the one talent also came up and said, ‘Master, I knew that you are a hard man, reaping where you didn’t sow and gathering where you scattered no seed.

25.verse: So I was afraid, and I went off and hid your talent in the ground. See, you have what is yours.’

26.verse: “But his master responded, ‘You wicked, lazy servant! You knew that I reap where I didn’t sow and gather where I scattered no seed?

27.verse: Then you should have brought my money to the brokers, and when I came I would have received it back with interest.

28.verse: Therefore take the talent away from him, and give it to the one who has the ten talents.

29.verse: For to the one who has, more shall be given, and he shall have an abundance. But from the one who does not have, even what he does have shall be taken away.

30.verse: Throw the worthless servant out, into the outer darkness where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’”

31.verse: The Righteous Judge - “Now when the Son of Man comes in His glory, and all the angels with Him, then He will sit on His glorious throne.

32.verse: All the nations will be gathered before Him, and He will separate them from one another, just as the shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.

33.verse: And He will put the sheep on His right, but the goats on His left.

34.verse: Then the King will say to those on His right, ‘Come, you who are blessed by My Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.

35.verse: For I was hungry and you gave Me something to eat; I was thirsty and you gave Me something to drink; I was a stranger and you invited Me in;

36.verse: I was naked and you clothed Me; I was sick and you visited Me; I was in prison and you came to Me.’

37.verse: “Then the righteous will answer Him, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry and feed You? Or thirsty and give You something to drink?

38.verse: And when did we see You a stranger and invite You in? Or naked and clothe You?

39.verse: When did we see You sick, or in prison, and come to You?’

40.verse: “And answering, the King will say to them, ‘Amen, I tell you, whatever you did to one of the least of these My brethren, you did it to Me.’

41.verse: Then He will also say to those on the left, ‘Go away from Me, you cursed ones, into the everlasting fire which has been prepared for the devil and his angels.

42.verse: For I was hungry and you gave Me nothing to eat; I was thirsty and you gave Me nothing to drink;

43.verse: I was a stranger and you did not invite Me in; naked and you did not clothe Me; sick and in prison and you did not visit Me.’

44.verse: “Then they too will answer, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison, and did not care for You?’

45.verse: Then He will answer them, saying, ‘Amen, I tell you, whatever you did not do for one of the least of these, you did not do for Me.’

46.verse: These shall go off to everlasting punishment, but the righteous into everlasting life.”

1.verse: The Conspiracy Grows - Now it happened that when Yeshua had finished all these words, He said to His disciples,

2.verse: “You know that Passover comes in two days, and the Son of Man will be handed over to be executed.”

3.verse: Then the ruling kohanim and elders of the people were gathered together in the court of the kohen gadol named Caiaphas.

4.verse: They plotted together in order that they might seize Yeshua by stealth and kill Him.

5.verse: “But not during the festival,” they were saying, “so there won’t be a riot among the people.”

6.verse: A Woman Anoints Yeshua for Burial - Now while Yeshua was in Bethany at the house of Simon ha-Metzora,

7.verse: a woman came up to Him with an alabaster jar of very expensive oil. And she poured it on His head as He was reclining at the table.

8.verse: But when the disciples saw this, they were indignant, saying, “Why this waste?

9.verse: It could have been sold for a lot, and the money given to the poor!”

10.verse: But Yeshua, knowing this, said to them, “Why do you cause trouble for this woman? She’s done Me a mitzvah.

11.verse: You always have the poor with you, but you won’t always have Me.

12.verse: For when she poured this oil on My body, she did it to prepare Me for burial.

13.verse: Amen, I tell you, wherever this Good News is proclaimed in all the world, what she has done will also be told in memory of her.”

14.verse: Betrayed and Sold for Silver - Then one of the Twelve, the one called Judah of Kriot, went to the ruling kohanim

15.verse: and said, “What are you willing to give me if I hand Him over to you?” And they weighed out thirty shekels of silver for him.

16.verse: From then on, Judah began looking for a chance to hand Him over.

17.verse: Now on the first day of matzah, the disciples came to Yeshua, saying, “Where do You want us to prepare for You to eat the Passover?”

18.verse: He said, “Go into the city to a certain man, and tell him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is near; at your house I am to keep the Passover with My disciples.”’”

19.verse: The disciples did as Yeshua had ordered them, and they prepared the Passover.

20.verse: Now when it was evening, Yeshua was reclining at the table with the Twelve.

21.verse: As they were eating, He said, “Amen, I tell you, one of you will betray Me.”

22.verse: And being very sorrowful, they began, each one, to say to Him, “I’m not the one, am I, Master?”

23.verse: And He replied, “The one who dipped his hand in the bowl with Me, he’s the one who will betray Me.

24.verse: The Son of Man indeed goes, just as it is written about Him; but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been better for that man if he had not been born!”

25.verse: And Judah, the one betraying Him, replied, “I’m not the one, am I, Rabbi?” Yeshua said to him, “You’ve said it yourself.”

26.verse: Now while they were eating, Yeshua took matzah; and after He offered the bracha, He broke and gave to the disciples and said, “Take, eat; this is My body.”

27.verse: And He took a cup; and after giving thanks, He gave to them, saying, “Drink from it, all of you;

28.verse: for this is My blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many for the removal of sins.

29.verse: But I say to you, I will never drink of this fruit of the vine from now on, until that day when I drink it anew with you in My Father’s kingdom.”

30.verse: After singing the Hallel, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

31.verse: Then Yeshua said to them, “This night you will all fall away because of Me; for it is written, ‘I will strike the Shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’

32.verse: But after I am raised up, I will go before you to the Galilee.”

33.verse: But Peter replied to Him, “Though all fall away because of You, I’ll never fall away.”

34.verse: Yeshua said to him, “Truly, I tell you, this very night, before a rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.”

35.verse: “Even if I must die with You,” Peter says to Him, “I’ll never deny You!” And so said all the disciples.

36.verse: “Your Will Be Done” - Then Yeshua comes with them to a place called Gethsemane, and He tells the disciples, “Sit here, while I go over there and pray.”

37.verse: And He took along Peter and Zebedee’s two sons, and He began to be sorrowful and troubled.

38.verse: Then He tells them, “My soul is deeply grieved, even to the point of death. Stay here and keep watch with Me.”

39.verse: Going a little farther, He fell face down and prayed, saying, “My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass from Me! Yet not as I will, but as You will.”

40.verse: Then He comes to the disciples and finds them sleeping; and He tells Peter, “So couldn’t you keep watch with Me for one hour?

41.verse: Keep watching and praying, so that you won’t enter into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”

42.verse: Again for a second time He went away and prayed, saying, “My Father, if this cannot pass away unless I drink it, let Your will be done.”

43.verse: And again He came and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy.

44.verse: So He left them again and prayed a third time, saying the same words once more.

45.verse: Then He comes to the disciples and says to them, “Still sleeping? Taking your rest? Look, the hour is at hand, and the Son of Man is being delivered into the hands of sinners.

46.verse: Get up, let’s go! Look, My betrayer is near.”

47.verse: Taken into Custody - While Yeshua was still speaking, here came Judah, one of the Twelve, and with him a big crowd with swords and clubs, from the ruling kohanim and elders of the people.

48.verse: Now His betrayer had given them a sign, saying, ‘The One I kiss, He’s the One—seize Him!’

49.verse: And immediately Judah drew near to Yeshua and said, “Shalom, Rabbi!” and kissed Him.

50.verse: “Friend,” Yeshua said to him, “do what you’ve come to do.” Then they came up and threw their hands on Yeshua and seized Him.

51.verse: And suddenly, one of those with Yeshua stretched out his hand and drew his sword, and he struck the kohen gadol’s servant and cut off his ear.

52.verse: Then Yeshua said to him, “Put your sword back in its place! For all who take up the sword shall perish by the sword.

53.verse: Or do you suppose that I cannot call on My Father, and at once He will place at My side twelve legions of angels?

54.verse: How then would the Scriptures be fulfilled, that it must be so?”

55.verse: At that hour Yeshua said to the crowds, “Have you come out with swords and clubs, to capture Me as you would a revolutionary? Every day I sat teaching in the Temple, and you didn’t seize Me.

56.verse: But all this has happened so that the writings of the prophets would be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples fled, abandoning Him.

57.verse: Now those who had seized Yeshua led Him away to Caiaphas, the kohen gadol, where the Torah scholars and elders had gathered.

58.verse: Peter was following Him from a distance as far as the courtyard of the kohen gadol. And after going inside, he was sitting with the guards, to see the outcome.

59.verse: Yeshua’s Trial Begins - Now the ruling kohanim and all the Sanhedrin kept trying to get false testimony against Yeshua so they could put Him to death.

60.verse: But they found none, though many false witnesses came forward. At last two came forward

61.verse: and said, “This fellow said, ‘I’m able to destroy the Temple of God and rebuild it in three days!’”

62.verse: The kohen gadol stood up and said to Yeshua, “Have You no answer? What’s this they’re testifying against You?”

63.verse: But Yeshua kept silent. The kohen gadol said to Him, “I charge You under oath by the living God, tell us if You are Mashiach Ben-Elohim!”

64.verse: “As you have said,” replied Yeshua. “Besides that, I tell you, soon after you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of power and coming on the clouds of heaven.”

65.verse: Then the kohen gadol tore his clothes and said, “Blasphemy! Why do we need any more witnesses? Look, you’ve heard the blasphemy.

66.verse: What’s your verdict?” “Guilty,” they answered. “He deserves death!”

67.verse: Then they spat in His face and pounded Him with their fists. Others slapped Him and demanded,

68.verse: “Prophesy to us, you Messiah! Which one hit You?”

69.verse: Peter Denies Yeshua - Meanwhile, Peter was sitting in the courtyard. A servant girl came over to him and said, “You also were with Yeshua of the Galilee.”

70.verse: But he denied it before everyone, saying, “I don’t know what you’re talking about!”

71.verse: When he went onto the porch, another servant girl saw him and said to those who were there, “This man was with Yeshua ha-Natzrati.”

72.verse: Again he denied it with an oath: “I don’t know the Man!”

73.verse: A little while later, some of the bystanders approached Peter and said to him, “Surely you’re one of them, too—your accent gives you away.”

74.verse: Then he began to curse and to swear an oath: “I do not know the Man!” Right then, a rooster crowed.

75.verse: Then Peter reminded himself of the word Yeshua had said: “Before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.” And he went away and wept bitterly.

1.verse: Judah’s Remorse - When daybreak came, the ruling kohanim and elders of the people conspired against Yeshua to put Him to death.

2.verse: And they tied Him up, led Him away, and handed Him over to Pilate, the governor.

3.verse: Then Judah, His betrayer, saw that Yeshua had been condemned. Feeling remorse, he brought the thirty silver pieces back to the ruling kohanim and elders,

4.verse: saying, “I’ve sinned, betraying innocent blood!” But they said, “What’s that to us? You see to it yourself!”

5.verse: After tossing the silver into the Temple sanctuary, he left. Then he went off and hanged himself.

6.verse: But the ruling kohanim took the silver pieces and said, “It is not permitted to put these in the treasury, since it is blood money.”

7.verse: So after they conferred, they bought with them the potter’s field, as a cemetery for strangers.

8.verse: For this reason that field has been called the “Field of Blood” to this day.

9.verse: Then was fulfilled what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet, saying, “And they took the thirty silver pieces, the price of Him on whom a price had been set by Bnei-Yisrael;

10.verse: and they gave them for the potter’s field, just as ADONAI arranged for me.”

11.verse: “Kill the King!” - Now Yeshua stood before the governor. The governor questioned Him, saying, “Are You the King of the Jews?” “You say so,” Yeshua said.

12.verse: And while He was accused by the ruling kohanim and elders, He did not answer.

13.verse: Then Pilate said to Him, “Don’t You hear how many things they testify against you?”

14.verse: Yeshua did not answer, not even one word, so the governor was greatly amazed.

15.verse: Now during the feast, the governor was accustomed to release to the crowd one prisoner, anyone they wanted.

16.verse: At that time they had a notorious prisoner, called Yeshua Bar-Abba.

17.verse: So when they were gathered together, Pilate said to them, “Which one do you want me to release for you? Yeshua who is Bar-Abba, or Yeshua who is called Messiah?”

18.verse: For he knew that they had handed Him over out of envy.

19.verse: While Pilate was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent him a message, saying, “Don’t have anything to do with that righteous Man, for today I’ve suffered many things in a dream because of Him.”

20.verse: Now the ruling kohanim and elders persuaded the crowds that they should ask for Bar-Abba and destroy Yeshua.

21.verse: But the governor responded, “Which of the two do you want me to release for you?” And they said, “Bar-Abba!”

22.verse: Pilate said to them, “What then shall I do with Yeshua, who is called Messiah?” “Execute Him!” all of them say.

23.verse: But Pilate said, “Why? What evil has He done?” But they kept shouting all the more, saying, “Let Him be executed!”

24.verse: When Pilate saw he was accomplishing nothing, but instead a riot was starting, he took some water and washed his hands in front of the crowd. “I am innocent of this blood,” he said. “You see to it yourselves!”

25.verse: All the people answered and said, “His blood be on us and on our children!”

26.verse: Then he released to them Bar-Abba. And after he had Yeshua scourged, he handed Him over to be crucified.

27.verse: Nailed to a Stake - Then the governor’s soldiers took Yeshua into the Praetorium and gathered the whole cohort around Him.

28.verse: They stripped Him and put a scarlet robe around Him.

29.verse: And after braiding a crown of thorns, they placed it on His head and put a staff in His right hand. And falling on their knees before Him, they mocked Him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”

30.verse: They spat on Him, and they took the staff and beat Him over and over on the head.

31.verse: When they finished mocking Him, they stripped the robe off Him and put His own clothes back on Him. And they led Him away to crucify Him.

32.verse: As they came out, they found a man from Cyrene, Simon by name. They forced him into service, to carry Yeshua’s cross-beam.

33.verse: And when they came to a place called Golgotha (that is to say, Place of a Skull),

34.verse: they offered Him wine mixed with gall to drink; but after tasting, He was unwilling to drink it.

35.verse: And when they had crucified Him, they divided His clothing among themselves by casting lots.

36.verse: And they sat down and kept guard over Him there.

37.verse: Over His head they put the charge against Him, which read: “THIS IS YESHUA, THE KING OF THE JEWS.”

38.verse: Then two outlaws were executed with Him, one on the right and one on the left.

39.verse: Those passing by were jeering at Him, shaking their heads

40.verse: and saying, “You who are going to destroy the Temple and rebuild it in three days, save Yourself! If you are Ben-Elohim, come down from the stake!”

41.verse: Likewise the ruling kohanim, along with the Torah scholars and elders, were also mocking Him.

42.verse: “He saved others,” they were saying, “but He can’t save Himself? He’s the King of Israel! Let Him come down now from the stake, and we’ll believe in Him!

43.verse: He trusts in God; let God rescue Him now, if He wants Him. For He said, ‘I am Ben-Elohim.’”

44.verse: Even the outlaws who were executed with Him were ridiculing Him in the same way.

45.verse: Yeshua Lays Down His Life - Now from the sixth hour, darkness fell upon all the land until the ninth hour.

46.verse: About the ninth hour Yeshua cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani?” that is, “My God, My God, why have You abandoned Me?”

47.verse: When some of those standing there heard it, they began saying, “This Man is calling for Elijah.”

48.verse: Right away one of them ran and took a sponge. He filled it with sour wine and put it on a stick, and was offering it to Yeshua to drink.

49.verse: But the rest were saying, “Leave Him alone! Let’s see if Elijah comes to save Him.”

50.verse: And Yeshua cried out again with a loud voice and gave up His spirit.

51.verse: And behold, the curtain of the Temple was split in two, from top to bottom. And the earth quaked and rocks were split apart.

52.verse: And the tombs were opened, and many bodies of the kedoshim who were sleeping were raised to life.

53.verse: And coming forth out of the tombs after His resurrection, they went into the holy city and appeared to many.

54.verse: Now the centurion, and those with him keeping guard over Yeshua, when they saw the earthquake and what was happening, they became terribly frightened and said, “This really was the Son of God!”

55.verse: The Tomb Is Sealed - Many women were there, watching from a distance. They had followed Yeshua from the Galilee, serving Him.

56.verse: Among them were Miriam from Magdala, Miriam the mother of Jacob and Joseph, and the mother of Zebedee’s sons.

57.verse: Now when it was evening, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who had also become a disciple of Yeshua.

58.verse: This man went to Pilate and asked for Yeshua’s body. Then Pilate ordered it to be given up.

59.verse: And Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth.

60.verse: And he laid it in his own new tomb, which he had cut in the rock. Then he rolled a large stone up to the door of the tomb and went away.

61.verse: Now Miriam from Magdala was there, and the other Miriam, sitting opposite the tomb.

62.verse: Guarding the Tomb - Now on the next day, which is after the preparation, the ruling kohanim and Pharisees were gathered before Pilate.

63.verse: “Sir,” they said, “we remember how that deceiver said while He was still alive, ‘After three days I’m to be raised.’

64.verse: Therefore, order the tomb to be made secure until the third day, so His disciples do not come and steal Him away. They will tell the people, ‘He is risen from the dead,’ and the last deception will be worse than the first!”

65.verse: “You have a guard,” Pilate said to them. “Go, make it as secure as you know how.”

66.verse: So they went and made the tomb secure, sealing the stone along with the soldiers of the guard.

1.verse: The Son Is Risen! - Now after Shabbat, as it began to dawn on the first day of the week, Miriam of Magdala and the other Miriam came to look at the tomb.

2.verse: And suddenly there was a great earthquake, for an angel of ADONAI descended from heaven and came and rolled back the stone and sat on it.

3.verse: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothing as white as snow.

4.verse: And those keeping watch were shaken for fear of him and became like dead men.

5.verse: But the angel answered and said to the women, “Do not be afraid, for I know you are looking for Yeshua who was crucified.

6.verse: He is not here; for He is risen, just as He said. Come, see the place where He was lying.

7.verse: Go quickly now and tell His disciples that He is risen from the dead. And behold, He’s going before you to the Galilee. There you will see Him. See, I have told you!”

8.verse: They quickly left the tomb, with fear yet with great joy, and ran to bring news to His disciples.

9.verse: The Good News Cannot Be Hidden - And behold, Yeshua met them. “Shalom!” He said. They drew near, grasped his feet, and worshiped Him.

10.verse: “Don’t be afraid,” Yeshua said to them. “Go tell My brothers to head for the Galilee, and there they will see Me.”

11.verse: Now while they were going, some of the guard came into the city and reported to the ruling kohanim all that had happened.

12.verse: And when they had assembled with the elders and consulted together, they gave a large sum of silver to the soldiers,

13.verse: saying, “Tell them, ‘His disciples came at night and stole Him away while we were sleeping.’

14.verse: And if this is heard by the governor, we’ll appease him and keep you out of trouble.”

15.verse: So the soldiers took the money and did as they were instructed. And this story was spread among the Judeans to this day.

16.verse: Authority to Make Disciples Everywhere - Now the eleven disciples went to the Galilee, to the mountain Yeshua had designated.

17.verse: When they saw Him, they worshiped; but some wavered.

18.verse: And Yeshua came up to them and spoke to them, saying, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to Me.

19.verse: Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, immersing them in the name of the Father and the Son and the Ruach ha-Kodesh,

20.verse: teaching them to observe all I have commanded you. And remember! I am with you always, even to the end of the age.”
